CHAPTER 701
Licensing in General
701.01   Application of chapter; conflicts.
701.02   Licenses required to engage in certain trades, businesses or
professions.
701.03   Fees.
701.04   Application for license.
701.05   Issuance of license.
701.06     Effective period.
701.07     Nontransferability.
701.08     Display of certificate.
701.09     Revocation or suspension.
701.10     Appeal and review.
701.99     Penalty.
 
701.01 APPLICATION OF CHAPTER; CONFLICTS.
   The provisions of this chapter apply to all other chapters of this Part
Seven - Business Regulation Code in general. In the event of any conflict
between any of the provisions of this chapter and any provision of any of the
other chapters, the provisions of the other chapters shall prevail, it being
the purpose of this chapter to provide coverage only in those areas not covered
by the other chapters.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
701.02 LICENSES REQUIRED TO ENGAGE IN CERTAIN TRADES, BUSINESSES OR
PROFESSIONS.
   No person shall engage in any of the trades, businesses or professions for
which licenses are required in this Business Regulation Code without first
applying for and obtaining a license from the Director of Service and Safety or
other duly authorized issuing authority.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
701.03 FEES.
   Before granting such license, the Director of Service and Safety, unless
otherwise directed by lawful authority, shall collect the license fees
prescribed in this Business Regulation Code for the trades, businesses and
professions requiring licenses as provided in the respective sections of these
Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
701.04 APPLICATION FOR LICENSE.
   (a) All original applications for licenses, unless otherwise specifically
provided, shall be made to the Director of Service and Safety in writing upon
forms to be furnished by him and shall contain:
      (1)   The name of the applicant and of each officer, partner or business
associate;
      (2)   The applicant's present occupation and place of business;
      (3)   The applicant's place of residence for five years next preceding
the date of application;
      (4)   The nature and location of the intended business or enterprise;
      (5)   The period of time for which the license is desired;
      (6)   If for a vendor, a description of the merchandise to be sold;
      (7)   Such other information concerning the applicant and his business as
may be reasonable and proper, having regard to the nature of the license
desired.
 
   (b) Renewal of an annual license may be granted to a licensee in good
standing upon the original application, unless otherwise provided.
 
   (c) With each original or renewal application, the applicant shall deposit
the fee required for the license requested.
 
   (d) No person shall knowingly make any false statement or representation in
such application.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
701.05 ISSUANCE OF LICENSE.
   Upon receipt of an application for a license, accompanied by the proper fee,
if approval by another officer, department or division is not required, the
Director of Service and Safety shall forthwith deposit the fee in the Treasury
and issue to the applicant a proper license certificate signed by such Director
with a certificate as to the amount paid. If for any reason the license is not
issued, the aforesaid deposit, less one dollar ($1.00) to cover expenses of
considering such application, shall be returned to the applicant.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
701.06 EFFECTIVE PERIOD.
   A license shall not be valid beyond the expiration date therein specified
and, unless otherwise provided, shall not extend beyond December 31 of the year
issued, except that at any time after December 14, licenses may be issued for
the ensuing calendar year. Unless otherwise specified, the full annual fee
shall be required of licenses irrespective of the date of issuance of such
license.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
701.07 NONTRANSFERABILITY.
   Every license shall be issued to a real party in interest in the enterprise
or business and, unless otherwise provided, no license shall be assigned or
transferred.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
701.08 DISPLAY OF CERTIFICATE.
   Every licensee carrying on business at a fixed location shall keep posted in
a prominent place upon the licensed premises, the license certificate. Other
licensees shall carry their license certificates at all times and whenever
requested by any officer or citizen, shall exhibit the same.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
701.09 REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION.
   Any license may be revoked by the Director of Service and Safety at any time
for conditions or considerations which, had they existed at the time of
issuance, would have been valid grounds for its denial; for any
misrepresentation of a material fact in the application discovered after
issuance of the license; for violation of any provision of this chapter or
other law or ordinance relating to operation of the business or enterprise for
which the license has been issued; or upon conviction of a licensee for
violation of any Federal, State or City law or ordinance involving moral
turpitude. Such revocation shall become effective upon notice served upon such
licensee or posted upon the premises affected.
   As a preliminary to revocation, the Director may issue an order suspending
such license, which shall become effective immediately upon service of written
notice to such licensee. Such notice shall specify the reason for suspension
and may provide conditions under which reinstatement of the license may be
obtained. Upon compliance with such conditions within the time specified, such
license may be restored.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
701.10 APPEAL AND REVIEW.
   In case any applicant has been denied a license, or if his license has been
revoked or suspended, the applicant or licensee, as the case may be, shall,
within three business days, have the right to appeal to Council from such
denial, revocation or suspension. Notice of appeal shall be filed in writing
with the Director of Service and Safety who shall fix the time and place for
hearing, the same to be not later than one week thereafter. The Director shall
notify the Mayor and all members of Council of the time and place of such
hearing not less than twelve hours in advance thereof. Three members of Council
shall constitute a quorum to hear such appeal. The appellant may appear and be
heard in person or by counsel. If, after hearing, a majority of the members of
Council present at such meeting declare in favor of the applicant, such license
shall be forthwith issued or fully reinstated, as the case may be; otherwise,
the order appealed from shall become final.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
701.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 705
Advertising
705.01   License required.
705.02   License fee.
705.03   Authority of Service-Safety Director.
705.04   Exception.
705.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.65
Requirements for licenses - see BUS. REG. Ch
701
 
705.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall post or paint advertising signs, distribute bills containing
advertising matter or tack any article or compound which has not been
manufactured or compounded within the corporate limits of the Municipality
without first having obtained a license to do so as hereinafter provided.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
705.02 LICENSE FEE.
   The license fee shall be two dollars ($2.00) for each day such person is
engaged in any of the activities described in Section
705.01, provided that any part of any calendar day shall be deemed a full day
for the purposes of this chapter.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
705.03 AUTHORITY OF SERVICE-SAFETY DIRECTOR.
   The Service-Safety Director shall have the power and authority to grant,
issue and revoke the license required by Section
705.01.
 
705.04 EXCEPTION.
   Nothing in this chapter shall apply to merchants or others doing business in
the Municipality or advertising their own business. Nor shall anything in this
chapter be construed as prohibiting the posting of bills, painting of
advertising signs or posting of cards upon private property if the consent of
the owner of such property has been obtained therefor.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
705.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
 
 
 
CHAPTER 713
Distress Merchandise Sales
713.01   Definitions.
713.02   Inventory and license required.
713.03   Application for license; fee.
713.04   Additional merchandise.
713.05   Records to be kept; inspection.
713.06   Revocation of license.
713.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Requirement for licenses - see BUS. REG. Ch.
701
 
713.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Person" means any individual, partnership, association, firm or
corporation.
   (b)   "Distress merchandise sale" means any offer to sell to the public, or
sale to the public, of goods, wares or merchandise on the implied or direct
representation that such sale is in anticipation that the sale will terminate
the business at its present location, or that is being held other than in the
ordinary course of business. Without limiting the generality of the above,
distress merchandise sales include any sale advertised either specifically or
in substance to be a "fire sale", "smoke and water damage sale", "adjustment
sale", "creditor's sale", "trustee's sale", "bankrupt sale", "save us from
bankruptcy sale", "insolvent sale", "insurance salvage sale", "mortgage sale",
"assignee's sale", "adjuster's sale", "must vacate sale", "quitting business
sale", "forced out of business sale" or "removal sale."
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.).
 
713.02 INVENTORY AND LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall conduct in the City any sale of goods, wares or merchandise
at retail, which sale is represented to the public as a distress merchandise
sale, or which, by representation, may lead the public to believe it to be a
distress merchandise sale, without first filing with the Director of Service
and Safety the inventory hereinafter provided for and obtaining from the
Director a license to do so. Such license shall be issued by the Director on
production of a receipt from the Director of Finance showing payment of the
proper license fees hereinafter provided for.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
713.03 APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; FEE.
   Any person desiring to conduct a distress merchandise sale shall make
written application to the Director of Service and Safety at least five days
before the date on which the sale is to commence, on forms furnished by the
Director showing the following data:
   (a)   The name and address of the owner of goods, wares or merchandise to be
sold;
   (b)   A description of the place where the sale will be held;
   (c)   A statement of facts regarding the distress merchandise, including the
reason why the sale is being held, and the commencement and termination dates
of the sale;
   (d)   Attached to the application shall be an inventory which shall contain
a complete and detailed list of the goods, wares and merchandise to be offered
at such sale, as disclosed by the applicant's records, or a statement of both
cost and retail value of the goods, wares and merchandise, based on the
physical inventory used for the applicant's most recent Federal income tax
return adjusted for sales, purchases or markdowns, shown on a monthly basis to
the date of the application. In addition, there shall be shown as separate
items in either form of inventory the value of all goods, wares or merchandise
the applicant has on consignment which will be offered for sale and the cost
and retail value of all goods, wares and merchandise on back order.
The license fee for such sale shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for a
period not to exceed two months.
      (Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
713.04 ADDITIONAL MERCHANDISE.
   A license shall be valid only for inventoried goods. Co-mingling of
additional merchandise with the inventoried merchandise shall cause the
merchandise inventoried to lose its identity as distressed goods and any such
license shall cease to apply to the sale of such goods.
   No person operating under such a license shall add any goods to the
inventoried stock and no goods shall be sold except those goods included in the
original inventory. Each sale of goods not so inventoried shall constitute a
separate offense under this chapter.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
713.05 RECORDS TO BE KEPT; INSPECTION.
   The licensee shall keep suitable books during the sale at the location at
which the sale is conducted. Daily entries showing the goods, wares and
merchandise sold each day shall be made in such books. Copies of such daily
entries shall be sent to the Treasurer weekly and all books of the licensee
shall be open for inspection by the Treasurer or his duly authorized
representative during business hours.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
713.06 REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
   The Director of Service and Safety shall revoke and licensee issued pursuant
to the provisions of this chapter if he finds that the licensee has:
   (a)   Violated any of the provisions of this chapter;
   (b)   Made any material misstatement in his application;
   (c)   Failed to include in the inventory required by the provisions of this
chapter, all the goods, wares and merchandise being offered for sale;
   (d)   Offered or permitted to be offered at sale any goods, wares or
merchandise not included in the inventory attached to the application;
   (e)   Failed to keep suitable records of the sale;
   (f)   Made or permitted to be made any false or misleading statements or
representations in advertising the sale, or in displaying, ticketing or
processing goods, wares or merchandise offered for sale.
713.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
less than twenty-five dollars ($25.00) nor more than one hundred dollars
($100.00) or imprisoned not more than thirty days, or both. (Ord. 3267. Passed
3-13-68.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 717
Home Sales
717.01   Definition.
717.02   Intent.
717.03   Prohibitions.
717.04   Fees and permits.
717.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Advertising - see BUS. REG. Ch.
705
 
717.01 DEFINITION.
   As used in this chapter, "home sale" means any sale of personal property to
the general public conducted on any portion of a residence property within an
R-1, R-2, or R-3 Zoning District, as described in the Zoning Code, including
but not limited to, garage sales, patio sales, yard sales, carport sales,
basement sales, porch sales and driveway sales.
(Ord. 3668. Passed 12-12-72.)
 
717.02 INTENT.
   (a)   It is the intent of this chapter to regulate, restrict and control
home sales on residence properties within residential zoning districts.
 
   (b)   It is not the intent of this chapter to prevent nonprofit
corporations, churches or recognized fraternities, clubs or lodges from
conducting such sales, provided they do so on real estate owned or occupied by
such organizations.
 
   (c)   It is further not the intent of this chapter to prohibit sales
conducted by nonconforming businesses, as defined in the Zoning Code, located
in residential zoning districts.
(Ord. 3668. Passed 12-12-72.)
 
717.03 PROHIBITIONS.
   (a) No person, firm or corporation shall conduct home sales within any
residential zoning district, as defined in the Zoning Code, in the City,
without first obtaining a permit from the Director of Service and Safety.
 
   (b) No person, firm or corporation who or which has obtained a permit as
required by subsection (a) hereof shall violate any of the provisions of this
chapter.
 
   (c)   No home sale shall be conducted by more than one resident without
consent of the Director of Service and Safety.
(Ord. 3668. Passed 12-12-72.)
 
   (d)   No home sale shall be conducted by the same resident or a member of
his family on the same residential property more than two times in any one
calendar year.
(Ord. 92-72. Passed 7-28-92.)
 
   (e)   No person shall offer any merchandise for sale at a home sale that has
been purchased for purposes of resale at such home sale. Any new merchandise
offered for sale shall be prima-facie evidence of such purchase for resale.
 
   (f)   No home sale shall be conducted during hours other than those hours
prescribed by the Director of Service and Safety and in no event shall a home
sale last more than three consecutive days.
 
   (g)   No person shall post or erect a sign for a home sale in violation of
any City ordinance regulating signs and advertisements.
(Ord. 3668. Passed 12-12-72.)
 
717.04 FEES AND PERMITS.
   (a)   The Director of Service and Safety shall provide applications for
permits for home sales. Such applications shall include the name of the
applicant, who shall be a resident of this City, his address, his telephone
number, the length of his residence in the City, the nature of the merchandise
to be offered for sale, the date of the sale, the hours of the sale, the
duration of the sale and any other information which the Director requires to
determine the identity of the applicant and the nature and location of the
sale.
 
   (b)   The Director of Service and Safety shall consider each application and
regulate the hours of each permit issued, except that no home sale shall be
commenced earlier than 9:00 a.m. or conducted later than 8:00 p.m. A copy of
each application shall be submitted to the Chief of Police for information and
filing.
(Ord. 3668. Passed 12-12-72.)
 
   (c)   A fee of five dollars ($5.00) shall be charged for each permit, except
for those home and/or yard sales held pursuant to Section
717.04(e).
(Ord. 11-39. Passed 7-26-11.)
   (d)   Every person conducting a home sale shall post his permit in a
prominent place upon the sale premises for inspection purposes and shall
exhibit the same upon request.
(Ord. 3668. Passed 12-12-72.)
   (e)   Between Memorial Day and Labor Day of each summer the Service-Safety
Director shall designate four (4) successive Saturdays as home sale or yard
sale Saturdays whereby the first two Saturdays shall be designated for home or
yard sales north of Columbus Avenue and the second two successive Saturdays
shall be designated as home or yard sales Saturdays south of Columbus Avenue
and where said yard sales on said successive Saturdays shall be permitted
without the payment of a fee for the home/yard sale permit as provided for in
Section
717.04(a).
(Ord. 11-39. Passed 7-26-11.)
 
717.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
chapter shall be fined, for a first offense, not less than five dollars ($5.00)
nor more than fifty dollars ($50.00), and, for a second or subsequent offense,
shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00) or imprisoned not
more than thirty days, or both. A separate offense shall be deemed committed
each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
(Ord. 3668. Passed 12-12-72.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 719
Street, Sidewalk and Mobile Food Vendors
 
719.01    Definitions
719.02   License required.
719.03   Application.
719.04   Fees.
719.05   Insurance.
719.06   Issuance of license.
719.07   Display of licenses.
719.08   Vending permitted in certain locations.
719.09   Prohibited conduct.
719.10   Suspension or revocation of license.
719.11      Special event license.
719.12      Farmer’s market.
719.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Peddlers and solicitors - see BUS. REG. Ch.
741
Temporary businesses - see BUS. REG. Ch.
745
 
719.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For purposes of this chapter, the following definitions shall apply:
   (a)   "Food" means a raw, cooked, or processed edible substance, ice,
beverage, or ingredient used or intended for use or for sale in whole or in
part for human consumption.
   (b)   "Food delivery operation" means a food service operation from which
food is ordered off-site by a customer, prepared, and delivered to the
customer. "Food delivery operation" includes, by way of example and not by way
of limitation, pizza delivery, sandwich delivery, restaurant delivery services,
or "food delivery sales operations" as defined in Ohio Revised Code 3717.01(H).
   (c)   "Food Service Operation" means a place, location, site, or separate
area where food intended to be served in individual portions is prepared or
served for a charge or required donation. As used in this chapter, "served"
means a response made to an order for one or more individual portions of food
in a form that is edible without washing, cooking, or additional preparation
and "prepared" means any action that affects a food other than receiving or
maintaining it at the temperature at which it was received.
   (d)   "Food trailer" means any vehicle without motive power that is designed
to be drawn by a motor vehicle and is specifically designed or used for food
vending operations.
   (e)   "Food truck" means a vehicle propelled by an engine which has been
specifically designed or used for mobile food vending.
   (f)   "Food vending operation" means a place, location, site, or separate
area where food intended to be served in individual portions is prepared or
served for a charge or required donation.
   (g)   "Licensing period" means January 1st through December 31st of each
calendar year.
   (h)   "Mobile food vending court" means a location designated by the City of
Bellefontaine on a temporary or permanent basis to allow two or more mobile
food vending units to operate from such location.
   (i)   "Mobile food vending unit" means a food service operation or retail
food establishment that is operated from a food truck, food trailer, pedi-food
cart, or pushcart, and that can or does routinely change location. For the
purposes of a license under this chapter, "mobile food vending unit" excludes
food delivery operations and vending machines, as defined in Ohio Revised Code
3717.01(L).
   (j)   "Mobile food vendor" means every person, firm, partnership,
corporation or other business owning, controlling, operating or managing any
mobile food vending unit.
   (k)   "Motor vehicle" means any vehicle used for the displaying, storing or
transporting of food, beverages or merchandise offered for sale by a vendor
which is required to be licensed and registered by the Department of Motor
Vehicles.
   (l)   "Pedi-food cart" means a vehicle propelled by human power which has
been specifically designed or used for mobile food vending and is or may be
operated on a road, street or alley.
   (m)   "Public streets or sidewalk" includes all public streets, sidewalks,
roadways, highways, parkways, alleys, public parks, public parking lots or any
other public way or area in the corporate limits of the City of Bellefontaine.
   (n)   "Pushcart" shall mean a vehicle propelled by human power which has
been specifically designed or used for mobile food vending. Vehicles not
specifically designed for mobile food vending including, by way of example and
not by way of limitation, racks, wheelbarrows, dollies, grocery carts, baby
carriages, tables, chairs, benches, cabinets, or other furniture and boxes,
buckets, tubs, or other containers or devices which normally rest on the ground
whether or not wheels have been attached shall not be licensed as pushcarts.
   (o)   "Retail food establishment" means a premises or part of a premises
where food is stored, processed, prepared, manufactured, or otherwise held or
handled for sale of food to a person who is the ultimate consumer.
   (p)   "Stand" means any table, showcase, bench, rack, pushcart, pedi-food
cart, wagon, or any other wheeled vehicle or device which may be moved without
the assistance of a motor and which is not required to be licensed and
registered by the Department of Motor Vehicles, used for the displaying,
storing or transporting of food, beverages or merchandise offered for sale by a
vendor.
   (q)   "Vendor" means any person, firm, partnership, corporation or other
business engaged in the selling or offering for sale, of food, beverages or
merchandise from a mobile food vending unit, stand or motor vehicle or from his
person.
      (Ord. 16-41. Passed 9-13-16.)
719.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.  
   No vendor shall sell, display or offer for sale any food, goods or
merchandise within the corporate limits of the City of Bellefontaine without a
current and valid license issued by the City.
(Ord. 16-41. Passed 9-13-16.)
719.03 APPLICATION.
   Any Vendor desiring to sell, display or offer for sale any food, goods or
merchandise within the corporate limits of the City of Bellefontaine shall
submit an application to the Service-Safety Director on an application form to
be provided by the City. The Service-Safety Director shall act within ten (10)
days of the filing of such application to either issue the requested license or
to deny the license.
   The application for a vendor's license shall contain all information
relevant and necessary to determine whether a particular license may be issued,
including but not limited to the following:
   (a)   The name, social security number, date of birth and address of the
applicant and of each employee of the applicant, the business name, business
address and employer identification number of the applicant, and proof of
identity.
   (b)   A brief description of the nature, character and quality of the food,
beverages, goods or merchandise to be sold, or for which orders are to be
taken.
   (c)   If employed by another, the name and business address of the person,
firm, association, organization, company or corporation by whom employed; if a
company or corporation, whether it is chartered or licensed to do business in
Ohio; the name and address of the statutory agent for service of process, and
the address of its principal office or place of doing business in Ohio if
different from the address called for above.
   (d)   A list of all political subdivisions within which the applicant has
engaged in business within the six-month period immediately preceding the date
of his application.
   (e)   If a motor vehicle is to be used in the vending business, a
description of the vehicle together with the motor vehicle registration number
and the license number, and the name and address of the registered owner of
such vehicle.
   (f)   A description of the proposed location(s) of the vending business,
size of stand to be used, the length of time during which it is proposed that
the business shall be conducted, and the written consent of the property owner
from which it will be conducted.
   (g)   The applicant shall submit proof that each person who operates the
vehicle(s) used in vending has a valid Ohio operator's license as required by
law.
   (h)   A photograph of the applicant and each employee who will be a vendor,
taken within sixty days immediately before the date of filing of the
application, which picture shall be at least two inches by two inches showing
the head and shoulders of the applicant in a clear and distinguishing manner.
   (i)   The name and address of two reliable persons who may be contacted as
to the good character and reputation of the applicant.
   (j)   Each applicant which will be vending food products shall provide
evidence of a valid food handler's permit or food service permit for the motor
vehicle or stand he will be vending from.
   (k)   Local non-profit service clubs and local non-profit organizations of
the City are exempt from obtaining a license under this chapter.
      (Ord. 16-41. Passed 9-13-16.)
719.04 FEES.
   An applicant for a license under this chapter shall pay an annual license
fee for the licensing period, or part thereof, in the amount on file in the
office of the Service-Safety Director.
(Ord. 16-41. Passed 9-13-16.)
719.05 INSURANCE.
   No license shall be issued to a Vendor who desires to sell any food, goods
or merchandise unless the Vendor furnishes proof of an insurance policy, issued
by an insurance company licensed to do business in the State of Ohio,
protecting the licensee and the City from all claims for damages to property
and bodily injury, including death, which may arise from operations under or in
connection with the license, in an amount of not less than five hundred
thousand dollars ($500,000). Such insurance shall name as additional insured
the City and shall provide that the policy shall not terminate or be cancelled
prior to the expiration date without thirty days advance written notice to the
City.
(Ord. 16-41. Passed 9-13-16.)
719.06 ISSUANCE OF LICENSE.
   (a) After a proper application has been submitted, the Service-Safety
Director shall issue a license to the applicant to engage in the selling or
offering to sell food, goods and merchandise, within the City, if he finds the
character and business responsibility of the applicant to be satisfactory, and
not a threat to the public health, welfare and safety of the residents of the
City.
 
   (b)   If the Service-Safety Director denies the issuance of the license, he
shall notify the applicant, in writing, of the reasons for the denial within
ten (10) days of his determination to deny the application. Such notice shall
be sent by certified mail to the applicant's address as set forth on his
application, or be delivered to the applicant personally, and shall be
considered served on the applicant on the date the notice is mailed or served
upon the applicant personally.
 
   (c)   The applicant, within fifteen days of his receipt of the denial of his
application for a permit may appeal the decision of the Service-Safety Director
to Council. Council shall hear the appeal at its next regular meeting and shall
issue a final decision on the appeal within thirty days after the hearing.
(Ord. 16-41. Passed 9-13-16.)
719.07 DISPLAY OF LICENSES.
   The license issued to a vendor shall be carried with the vendor while he or
she is engaged in the business of vending and shall be displayed in a
conspicuous place.
(Ord. 16-41. Passed 9-13-16.)
719.08 VENDING PERMITTED IN CERTAIN LOCATIONS.
   (a)   Vending shall only be permitted in districts zoned B-2 and B-3.
 
   (b)   Unless otherwise allowable, no vendor shall be permitted to sell food,
goods or merchandise within 150 feet of a retail food establishment.
(Ord. 16-41. Passed 9-13-16.)
 
719.09  PROHIBITED CONDUCT.
   No vendor shall:
    (a)    Vend within 200 feet of the grounds of any elementary or secondary
school between one-half hour prior to the start of the school day and one-half
hour after dismissal at the end of the school day.
    (b)    Vend within 200 feet of any hospital.
   (c)    Vend within 200 feet of any church while church is in session.
    (d)    Sell food or beverages for immediate consumption unless he has
available for public use his own or a public litter receptacle which is
available for his patrons use.
   (e)    Leave any location without first picking up, removing and disposing
of all trash or refuse remaining from sales made by him.
    (f)    Solicit or conduct business with persons in motor vehicles.
    (g)    Sell anything other than that which he is licensed to vend.
   (h)    Set up, maintain, or permit the use of any table, crate, carton, rack
or any other device to increase the selling or display capacity of his stand or
motor vehicle where such items have not been described in his application.
    (i)    Vend without the insurance coverage specified in Section
719.05.
    (j)    No vendor vending from a motor vehicle, vehicle, pushcart, wagon or
any wheeled vehicle shall:
       (1)    Double park or park in any manner contrary to any ordinance about
parking when attempting to make a sale.
       (2)    Make or attempt to make a sale within a public park, or within
200 feet of a public park.
       (3)    Permit any person except an employee of the licensee to ride in
or on the vehicle.
       (4)    Refuse to remove his vehicle from any public street or sidewalk
in the City upon the request of a police officer, during periods of congested
traffic, accident or public emergency.
         (Ord. 95-07. Passed 1-10-95.)
719.10  SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
   Any license issued under this chapter may be temporarily suspended or
revoked by the Director of Safety and Service for any of the following reasons:
    (a)    Fraud or misrepresentation in the application for license.
    (b)    Fraud or misrepresentation in the course of conducting the business
of vending.
    (c)    Conducting the business of vending contrary to the conditions of the
license.
   (d)    Conviction of the licensee of any crime or violation of Municipal
ordinance or State law involving moral turpitude.
    (e)    Conducting the business of vending in such a manner as to create a
public nuisance, a breach of the peace or to constitute a danger to the public
health, safety or welfare of the public.
   On the next business day following the suspension or revocation of a
license, a notice of hearing on such suspension or revocation shall be made in
writing, shall set forth specifically the grounds for suspension or revocation,
and the date, time and place of the hearing. Such notice shall be mailed,
certified mail, postage prepaid, to the licensee at the address stated on the
application for the licensee at least five days before the date set for the
hearing. The written decision of the Director of Safety and Service made at or
after such hearing, with a statement of the grounds therefore, shall be mailed,
postage prepaid, to the licensee at the address stated on the application for
the license within ten days after the date of the hearing. The decision of the
Director of Public Safety and Service may be appealed in the same manner as set
forth in Section
 719.06.
(Ord. 95-07. Passed 1-10-95.)
719.11 SPECIAL EVENT LICENSE.
   Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Chapter
719, a Vendor desiring to participate in a special event to sell, display or
offer for sale any food, goods or merchandise within the corporate limits of
the City of Bellefontaine shall submit an application for a special event
license to the Service-Safety Director on an application form to be provided by
the City. The license fee for special events shall be an amount on file in the
office of Service-Safety Director. The Service-Safety Director shall act within
ten (10) days of the filing of such application to either issue the requested
license or to deny the license. “Special events” are those events identified as
such by the Service-Safety Director, including the exact location of the event
and time period during which the event shall take place. If there is a conflict
between the terms of this Section
719.11 and any other provisions of Chapter
719, the terms of this Section
719.11 shall control. Otherwise, all other terms and conditions of Chapter
719 shall remain in full force and effect.
(Ord. 18-46. Passed 7-10-18.)
719.12 FARMER’S MARKET.
   Notwithstanding the other terms and conditions of Chapter
719 of the Codified Ordinances of the City of Bellefontaine, Ohio, each
Farmer’s Market shall be permitted by the City of Bellefontaine upon
application and payment of an annual fee which are on file in the office of the
Service-Safety Director. A Farmer’s Market permit is required for any outdoor
sales of seasonal, non-manufactured items typically sold outdoors. Typically
these sales are conducted in a parking lot from within a tent, any other
temporary structure, truck, trailer or similar vehicle or structure. Any person
or entity having a Farmer’s Market permit must obtain all state, county, health
and other applicable permits, licenses and vendor numbers for the specific
location in use.
(Ord. 18-68. Passed 10-23-18.)
719.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the fourth degree and shall be fined not less than one hundred dollars
($100.00). Each day of operation in violation of this chapter shall be
considered a separate offense.
(Ord. 95-07. Passed 1-10-95.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 721
Junk Yards
721.01   Definitions.
721.02   Regulations.
721.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
State licensing and required fencing of junk yards outside a municipality - see
Ohio R.C. 4737.05 et seq.
Littering and deposit of garbage, rubbish and junk - see GEN. OFF.
521.08
 
721.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Junk" means old or scrap copper, brass, rope, rags, trash, waste,
batteries, paper, rubber, junked, dismantled or wrecked automobiles or parts
thereof, iron, steel and other old or scrap ferrous or nonferrous materials.
   (b)   "Junk yard" means an establishment or place of business which is
maintained or operated for the purpose of storing, keeping, buying or selling
junk, or for the maintenance or operation of an automobile graveyard, and
includes garbage dumps and sanitary landfills. For the purposes of this chapter
"junk yard" also includes scrap metal processing facilities which are located
within 1,000 feet of the nearest edge of the right of way of a highway in the
interstate or primary system, and site, location or premises on which are kept
two or more junk motor vehicles, as defined in Ohio R.C. 4513.63, whether or
not for a commercial purpose.
   (c)   "Interstate system" means the system of highways as defined in the
"Act of August 27, 1958," 72 Stat. 887.23 U.S.C.A. 103 (D), as amended.
   (d)   "Primary system" means that portion of the highway system designated
by the Ohio Director of Highways which has been approved by the Secretary of
Transportation of the United States pursuant to the "Act of August 27, 1958,"
72 Stat. 887,23 U.S.C.A. 103 (B), as amended.
      (Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
721.02 REGULATIONS.
   No person shall carry on, maintain or conduct a junk yard or store wrecked
or abandoned vehicles or other junk, unless such establishment is carried on,
maintained or conducted in compliance with the following regulations:
   (a)   Such establishment shall be carried on, maintained or conducted in an
enclosed building or buildings or upon a lot fenced on all sides. The sides of
such premises which abut any street or avenue within the City which are open
shall be fenced with nontransparent material, shall be at least six feet in
height and not more than ten feet in height. Along such fence fronting any
street or avenue, a sufficient number of shrubs, trees, hedges or evergreens
shall be planted so as to screen the premises from view.
   (b)   All such fences and shrubbery shall be maintained in a neat,
substantial and safe condition and so as to obscure the junk from the ordinary
view of persons passing upon the public ways.
   (c)   The material located in or upon the premises shall be arranged so that
reasonable inspection or access on all parts of the premises can be had at any
time by the proper fire, health, police and building authorities.
   (d)   Water shall not be permitted to accumulate in any of the car bodies
for such a period of time that it becomes vile, stagnant or infested with
mosquitoes. Weeds and rank vegetation shall not be permitted on the premises.
   (e)   The entire junk yard shall be kept free from vermin, rodents, reptiles
or other animals, except those properly licensed, and the owner or operator of
such premises shall install effective means of rodent and pest control.
   (f)   The intentional burning of automobile bodies, their parts or other
junk is prohibited.
      (Ord. 3088. Passed 8-23-65.)
721.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 729
Lodging Houses
729.01   Definition.
729.02   Guest registers.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Guests to register - see Ohio R.C. 3503.31
Hotels - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 3731
False registration - see Ohio R.C. 3731.17
Defrauding a hostelry - see GEN. OFF.
545.03
 
729.01 DEFINITION.
   Every hotel, tourist court, motel, rooming house or other business
enterprise maintaining five or more furnished rooms which are maintained for
rental to guests or lodgers shall be known as a lodging house and as such
subject to the provisions of this chapter.
(1956 Code Sec. 54.2)
 
729.02 GUEST REGISTERS.
   Every proprietor of a lodging house shall maintain a guest register and each
guest shall be required to sign his name and address upon such register prior
to occupying a room or rooms in such establishment. Registrations shall be made
in chronological order, and the date and time of arrival and departure of each
guest and the number of the room or suite assigned to him shall be noted in the
register.
   In the case of motels or tourist courts, the make of automobile, the name of
the state of registration and the license number of each guest's car shall be
noted on the register.
   The guest register shall be open for inspection by City officials at all
times.
(1956 Code Sec. 54.6)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 730
Medical Marijuana
730.01   Purpose.
730.02   Definitions.
730.03   General conditions for medical marijuana entities.
730.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Drug abuse control - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
513
730.01 PURPOSE.
   It is the purpose of Section
730.01 to
730.99 inclusive of this Ordinance to regulate the location, operation, and
maintenance of medical marijuana entitles in order to promote the public
health, safety, and welfare. It is the intent of these Sections to prohibit the
cultivation, processing and dispensing of medical marijuana in the City of
Bellefontaine, Ohio.
(Ord. 19-16. Passed 3-26-19.)
730.02 DEFINITIONS.
   Medical marijuana related definitions:
   (a)   Cultivate. Means to grow, harvest, package, and transport medical
marijuana pursuant to ORC 3796.
   (b)   Cultivator. Means an entity that has been issued a certificate of
operation by the State of Ohio to grow, harvest, package, and transport medical
marijuana as permitted under ORC 3796.
   (c)   Dispensary. Means an entity licensed pursuant to ORC 3796 and any
rules promulgated thereunder to sell medical marijuana to qualifying patients
and caregivers.
   (d)   Dispense. Means the delivery of medical marijuana to a patient or the
patient’s registered caregiver that is packaged in a suitable container
appropriately labeled for subsequent administration to or use by a patient as
permitted by Ohio law in accordance with Ohio law.
   (e)   Manufacture. Means the process of converting harvested plant material
into marijuana extract by physical or chemical means for use as an ingredient
in a medical marijuana product.
   (f)   Marihuana. Has the same meaning as defined in ORC 3719.01, as amended
from time to time.
   (g)   Marijuana. Has the same meaning as defined in ORC 3796.01, as amended
from time to time.
   (h)   Medical Marijuana. Has the same meaning as defined in ORC 3796.01, as
amended from time to time.
   (i)   Medical Marijuana Entity. Means a medical marijuana cultivator,
processor, dispensary, or testing laboratory licensed by the State of Ohio.
   (j)   Processor. Means an entity that has been issued a certificate of
operation by the State of Ohio to manufacture medical marijuana products.
   (k)   Testing Laboratory. Means an independent laboratory located in Ohio
that has been issued a certificate of operation by the State of Ohio to have
custody and use of controlled substances for scientific and medical purposes
and for purposes of instruction research, or analysis.
      (Ord. 19-16. Passed 3-26-19.)
730.03 GENERAL CONDITIONS FOR MEDICAL MARIJUANA ENTITIES.
   In the interest of protecting the public health, safety, and general
welfare, this section establishes zoning regulations that provide for State-
authorized medical marijuana land uses consistent with ORC 519 and ORC 3796.
ORC 519.21 and ORC 3796 allows regulation of the location of medical marijuana
cultivators, processors, or dispensaries within the City of Bellefontaine,
Ohio.
   (a)   Cultivators, Processors and Dispensaries Prohibited. Cultivators,
processors and dispensaries of medical marijuana are strictly prohibited in the
City of Bellefontaine, Ohio.
   (b)   Not an Agricultural Use. Medical marijuana is not considered an
“agricultural” use.
   (c)   Mobile Building Prohibited. No medical marijuana entity shall be
located within a mobile building.
      (Ord. 19-16. Passed 3-26-19.)
730.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a
misdemeanor of the first degree, with penalties as provided in Section
501.99 of the Codified Ordinances of the City of Bellefontaine, Ohio.
(Ord. 19-16. Passed 3-26-19.)
 
 
CHAPTER 731
Recreational Marijuana
731.01    Definitions.
731.02    Adult use cannabis operators prohibited.
731.99    Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Drug abuse control - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
513
731.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this chapter, the following definitions shall apply
unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning.
   (a)   ADULT USE CANNABIS or CANNABIS or MARIJUANA or MARIHUANA. These terms
are defined as the term "marihuana" is defined in Ohio Revised Code Section
3719.01.
   (b)   ADULT USE CANNABIS OPERATOR. A level I adult use cultivator, a level
II adult use cultivator, a level III adult use cultivator, an adult use
processor, and an adult use dispensary, as defined by Ohio Revised Code Section
3780.01.
   (c)   ADULT USE CULTIVATOR. A level I adult use cultivator or a level II
adult use cultivator.
   (d)   ADULT USE DISPENSARY. A person licensed pursuant to Ohio Revised Code
Section 3780.15, other provisions of Chapter 3780 ofthe Ohio Revised Code, and
any rules promulgated thereunder to sell adult use cannabis authorized.
   (e)   ADULT USE PROCESSOR. A person licensed pursuant to Ohio Revised Code
Section 3780.14, other provisions of Chapter 3780 of the Ohio Revised Code, and
any rules promulgated thereunder to manufacture adult cannabis as authorized.
   (f)   LEVEL I ADULT USE CULTIVATOR, LEVEL II ADULT USE CULTIVATOR, AND LEVEL
III ADULT USE CULTIVATOR. These terms are defined as they are defined in Ohio
Revised Code Section 3780.01.
      (Ord. 25-04. Passed 3-11-25.)
   
731.02 ADULT USE CANNABIS OPERATORS PROHIBITED.
   Pursuant to Ohio Revised Code Section 3780.25, adult use cannabis operators
are strictly prohibited in the City of Bellefontaine.
(Ord. 25-04. Passed 3-11-25.)
731.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a
misdemeanor of the first degree, with penalties as provided in Section
501.99 of the Codified Ordinances ofthe City of Bellefontaine, Ohio. (Ord. 25-
04. Passed 3-11-25.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 737
Oil and Gas Wells
737.01   Drilling prohibited.
737.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
State law provisions - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 1509
Oil and gas drilling - see OAC Ch. 1501-1, 1501:9-9
 
737.01 DRILLING PROHIBITED.
   No person shall drill for oil, gas or hydrocarbons within the corporate
limits of the City.
(Ord. 2984. Passed 4-27-64.)
 
737.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 741
Peddlers and Solicitors
741.01   Uninvited and nonpermitted peddling and soliciting prohibited.
741.02   Enforcement.
741.03   Invited peddling and soliciting; registration required.
741.04   Application for permit, fee, content and display.
741.05   Application of chapter.
741.06   Time limitations.
741.07   Revocation of permit.
741.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to inspect food products - see Ohio R.C. 715.46
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.61 et seq.
Home solicitation sales - see Ohio R.C. 1345.21 et seq.
Charitable solicitations - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 1716
Frozen desserts - see Ohio R.C. 3717.51 et seq.
Trespassing - see GEN. OFF.
541.05
 
741.01 UNINVITED AND NONPERMITTED PEDDLING AND SOLICITING PROHIBITED.
   The practice of going in and upon the private residences in the City by
canvassers, solicitors, peddlers, hawkers, itinerant merchants and transient
vendors of merchandise and services, not having been requested or invited to do
so by the owners or occupants of such private residences, for the purpose of
soliciting orders for the sale of goods, wares, merchandise or services or for
the purpose of disposing of or peddling or hawking the same, is hereby declared
to be a nuisance and is prohibited unless such parties have obtained a permit
under Section 741.04 herein.
(Ord. 19-34. Passed 6-11-19.)
 
741.02 ENFORCEMENT.
   The Chief of Police and the Police Department are hereby required and
directed to suppress and abate any such nuisance as is described in Section
741.01.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
741.03 INVITED PEDDLING AND SOLICITING; REGISTRATION REQUIRED.
   This section has intentionally been deleted.
(Ord. 19-34. Passed 6-11-19.)
 
741.04 APPLICATION FOR PERMIT; FEE, CONTENT AND DISPLAY.
   (a)   No canvasser, solicitor, peddler, hawker, itinerant merchant or
transient vendor of merchandise or services shall go in or upon any private
residence without first applying for and obtaining a permit from the office of
the Director of Service and Safety. The Director of Service-Safety shall
determine the forms and information required for the granting of such permits.
   (b)   Each applicant for a permit whom shows evidence of good character
shall be furnished a permit upon the payment of forty dollars ($40.00) per
year.
   (c)   Each permittee shall at all times while peddling or hawking in the
City carry upon his person his permit and the same shall be exhibited by such
permittee whenever he is requested to do so by any police officer or by any
person solicited.
(Ord. 19-34. Passed 6-11-19.)
 
741.05 APPLICATION OF CHAPTER.
   The provisions of this chapter, shall not apply to the following:
   (a)   Officer or employee of the City, County, State or Federal government,
or any subdivision thereof, when on official business;
   (b)   Any person who sells or offers to sell agricultural products of his
own raising or merchandise of his own manufacture; and
   (c)   Any person soliciting or peddling for, or selling tickets for, any
religious, charitable, educational, fraternal, military service veteran’s or
character building organization having an established organization with Logan
County, Ohio.
      (Ord. 19-34. Passed 6-11-19.)
 
741.06 TIME LIMITATIONS.
   No activity permitted under authority of this chapter shall commence prior
to 9:00 a.m. nor continue after 5:00 p.m. This time limitation shall be stated
on the permit.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
741.07 REVOCATION OF PERMIT.
   Permits issued under this chapter may be revoked by the Director of Service
and Safety for the following reasons:
   (a)   Fraud or misrepresentation contained in the registration;
   (b)   Fraud, misrepresentation or false statements made in the course of
conducting the activity;
   (c)   Violation of any of the provisions of this chapter or of these
Codified Ordinances or of any State of Federal law;
   (d)   Conducting the business in an unlawful manner or in such a manner as
to constitute a menace to the health, saftey or general welfare of the public;
   (e)   The permittee ceases to possess the qualifications and character
required in this chapter for the original registration.
   The revocation of a permit shall be in addition to any penalty provided in
Section
741.99 or any other penalty that may be imposed upon the permittee.
 
741.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each offense. A separate offense
shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or
continues and with respect to each person or residence solicited.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 745
Temporary Businesses
745.01   Definitions.
745.02   Temporary business license; fee and duration.
745.03   License revocation.
745.04   Deposit for cleaning premises.
745.05   Exceptions.
745.06   Appeal procedure.
745.07   Display of license.
745.99   Penalty.
 
745.01 DEFINITIONS.
   "Temporary place of business" means any public or quasi-public place
including, but not limited to, any hotel, rooming house, storeroom, building or
part of a building, that is temporarily being occupied for the purpose of
making retail sales of goods to the public. A place of business is not
temporary if the same persons or firm conducted business at the place
continuously for more than six months or occupied the premises as their
permanent residence for more than six months.
(Ord. 93-88. Passed 11-9-93.)
 
745.02 TEMPORARY BUSINESS LICENSE; FEE AND DURATION.
   (a)   Each person, whether principal or agent, who proposes to conduct or
engage in the sale of goods, wares, merchandise, property, tangible or
intangible, of any nature whatsoever, and services, from a temporary place of
business, within the City, shall, before opening same and before offering sale
of such goods, wares, merchandise, property and/or services procure a license
to do so from the Director of Public Service-Safety, which application shall be
made not less than fifteen days prior to the time such activity is to take
place.
 
   (b)   The applicant for a temporary business license shall furnish the
Service-Safety Director with the following information on forms provided by the
City:
      (1)   Full name of the applicant.
      (2)   Date of birth of the applicant.
      (3)   Local address, if any.
      (4)   Permanent home address.
      (5)   A physical description of the applicant, setting forth age, height,
weight, color of hair and eyes, and sex.
      (6)   Social Security number, if any.
      (7)   A description of the nature of the business and the location and
the goods, wares, merchandise, property and/or services to be sold. Written
consent of the owner of the premises or other duly authorized person shall be
provided.
      (8)   Telephone number of the applicant.
      (9)   Number of employees.
      (10)   Date and hours of operation.
      (11)   Whether the applicant has ever been convicted of a crime and, if
so, where and the nature of the offense and the punishment or penalty imposed
therefor.
      (12)   Such other information as the Director may require.
 
   (c)   A nonrefundable fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be
submitted with the application.
 
   (d)   The applicant shall further register with the Superintendent of
Taxation providing the Superintendent his name, address, person or persons to
whom correspondence may be directed and such other information as the
Superintendent may require.
 
   (e)   The license shall be valid for a period not to exceed thirty days from
the date of issuance unless earlier revoked. No license issued hereunder shall
be assigned or transferred to another person.
 
   (f)   The Service-Safety Director shall issue a license to the applicant
unless he has determined:
      (1)   That the applicant has made a false, misleading or deceptive
statement in providing the information required under subsection (b) hereof; or
      (2)   That the applicant has been convicted of a felony or of a
misdemeanor involving moral turpitude during the five years preceding the date
of application; or
      (3)   That the proposed location of the temporary business would
constitute a hazard to the public health, safety and welfare; or
      (4)   That the applicant has not registered with the Superintendent of
Taxation as provided in subsection (d) hereof.
         (Ord. 93-88. Passed 11-9-93.)
 
745.03 LICENSE REVOCATION.
   A license issued under this chapter shall be revoked by the Service-Safety
Director for any of the following causes:
   (a)   It is subsequently determined that the licensee provided false,
misleading or deceptive information in completing the application form set
forth in Section 721.04.
   (b)   The licensee is convicted of a felony or of a misdemeanor involving
moral turpitude.
   (c)   The licensee is convicted of a violation of any provision of this
chapter.
      (Ord. 93-88. Passed 11-9-93.)
 
745.04 DEPOSIT FOR CLEANING PREMISES.
   The applicant shall also deposit, before such license is issued, the sum of
one hundred dollars ($100.00) to guarantee the cost of cleaning the premises
and removing any property therefrom after the termination of the business. If
the premises on which such business is conducted are not cleaned and all
merchandise, property and refuse are not removed therefrom and properly
disposed of within forty-eight hours after the termination of the business, the
Service-Safety Director shall immediately cause such work to be done and deduct
such cost and return any balance of the deposit. The licensee shall be liable
for any deficiency.
(Ord. 93-88. Passed 11-9-93.)
 
745.05 EXCEPTIONS.
   (a)   The provisions of Section
745.02 through
745.04 shall not apply to merchants who offer Christmas trees for sale at their
place of business.
 
   (b)   The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to any activity, event
or function conducted by or on behalf of any recognized nonprofit, educational,
philanthropic, civic, religious, political or charitable organization or group
or person on its behalf registers with the Service-Safety Director stating the
name of the organization or group, the nature of the activity, event or
function being conducted, the duration and location of such activity, event or
function and furnishes any other information deemed necessary by the Service-
Safety Director, including evidence satisfactory to the Director that the
organization or group is a recognized nonprofit, educational, philanthropic,
civic, religious, political or charitable organization or group and that the
person registering the organization or group is, in fact, authorized to act on
its behalf. Written consent of the owner of the premises or other duly
authorized person shall be provided. The registration shall be valid for a
period not to exceed thirty days but may be renewed. The proposed location of
the activity, event or function shall not constitute a hazard to the public
health, safety and welfare and shall be approved by the Director, if it meets
all such qualifications.
 
   (c)   Persons offering or exposing for sale agricultural articles or
products other than pursuant to subsection (b) hereof or persons selling by
sample only shall be exempt from the payment of all license fees, but shall in
all other respects comply with the provisions of this chapter. As used herein,
agricultural articles or products means commodities used as food or
nonalcoholic drink for human consumption.
(Ord. 93-88. Passed 11-9-93.)
 
745.06 APPEAL PROCEDURE.
   If an application for a license is not approved or if any license issued
pursuant to the provisions of this chapter is revoked, written notice shall be
given to the applicant or licensee by personal service or by certified mail.
The applicant or licensee shall have the right to appeal such disapproval or
revocation to the Board of Zoning Appeals in accordance with provisions of the
Codified Ordinances. The Board shall have the power to affirm, modify or
reverse the decision of the Director. Any such decision made by the Board shall
be final.
(Ord. 93-88. Passed 11-9-93.)
 
745.07 DISPLAY OF LICENSE.
   Any person conducting a temporary business within this City who has obtained
a license in accordance with the provisions of this chapter shall, upon demand,
exhibit such license to any police officer or other City official.
(Ord. 93-88. Passed 11-9-93.)
 
745.99 PENALTY.
   Whosoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more
than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisoned not more than six months, or
both. Each day's continued violation of any provision of this chapter shall
constitute a separate offense for purposes of this penalty provision.
(Ord. 93-88. Passed 11-9-93.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 773
Taxicabs
773.01   Definition.
773.02   Licenses required; fees.
773.03   Application for operator's license.
773.04   Issuance of operator's license.
773.05   Application, examination and fees for taxicab driver license.
773.06   Suspension or revocation of operator's license.
773.07   Renewal of license.
773.08   Rates.
773.09   Taxicab equipment requirements.
773.10   Limitations on use.
773.11   Records.
773.12   Limitation on number of taxicabs.
773.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.22, 715.66
Power to establish stands and fix rates - see Ohio R.C. 715.25
Director of Service and Safety designates stands - see TRAF.
305.04
Vehicle operation and equipment - see TRAF. Ch.
331,
337
State driver's license requirements - TRAF. Ch.
335
 
773.01 DEFINITION.
   As used in this chapter, "taxicab" means any motor vehicle whose owner or
driver solicits, secures or accepts passengers for hire upon hail or request on
the streets and other public ways of the City. It does not include a vehicle
such as a bus, street car, trackless trolley or other vehicle furnishing
transportation to the public on a fixed schedule or route.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
773.02 LICENSES REQUIRED; FEES.
   (a)   No person shall operate a taxicab business or proffer the services of
a taxicab without first obtaining a license therefor from the Service-Safety
Director. The annual fee for such license shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00)
for the first taxicab and ten dollars ($10.00) for each additional taxicab
employed in such business. Effective January 1, 1978, the annual fee shall be
fifty dollars ($50.00) for each taxicab business entity.
 
   (b)   No person shall operate a taxicab without first obtaining a license
therefor from the Service-Safety Director. The annual fee for such license
shall be fifteen dollars ($15.00). Such operator licenses shall be valid for
one year from the date of issuance.
(Ord. 77-23. Passed 5-10-77.)
 
773.03 APPLICATION FOR OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   Each applicant for a taxicab operator's license shall present and file with
the Service-Safety Director an application setting forth the following
information, in addition to the information required of licenses by Section
701.04:
   (a)   The trade name under which he intends to do business;
   (b)   The number of vehicles for which the license is desired with a
description of each;
   (c)   The markings or letterings to be used on each taxicab;
   (d)   Any other information required by rule or regulation of the Director.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
773.04 ISSUANCE OF OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   (a)   The Service-Safety Director shall investigate and may hold a hearing
upon each application for an operator's license. If he finds from such
investigation and hearing that the public convenience and necessity do not
justify the operation of the vehicles for which the license is desired, he
shall forthwith notify the applicant of his findings. If he finds from such
investigation and hearing that the public convenience and necessity do justify
the operation of the vehicles for which the license is desired, he shall
require the following from the applicant:
      (1)   A full description of each vehicle for which the license is desired
and the State license number of each such vehicle.
      (2)   An unexpired official certificate from an authorized motor vehicle
inspection station of the City or the State that each such vehicle has been
inspected and tested and found to meet the standards of safety fixed by statute
and ordinance and that each such vehicle is roadworthy and safe for operation
as a taxicab.
      (3)   The name, address, telephone number, fingerprints, driver's license
number and photograph of each person who will drive the taxicab. The photograph
shall be a close-up view, two inches by three inches, and taken within thirty
days next preceding the date of application.
      (4)   A policy or policies of liability insurance issued for the life of
the license applied for or longer, by a responsible insurance company, approved
as to sufficiency by the Service-Safety Director and as to legality by the
Solicitor, covering the cab and its owner and operator for liability for loss
resulting from the operation of each such taxicab to the extent of one hundred
thousand dollars ($100,000) on account of injury or death of one person in any
one accident; three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000) on account of injury or
death of more than one person in any one accident; and fifty thousand dollars
($50,000) for property damage caused in any one accident.
 
   (b)   In lieu of the policies of insurance above described, the applicant
may furnish a bond binding the principal and sureties to liability for damages
to the extent of one hundred thousand dollars/three hundred thousand dollars/
fifty thousand dollars ($100,000/300,000/50,000), respectively, as set forth
herein, with at least two approved personal sureties or one approved corporate
surety approved as to sufficiency by the Director and as to legality by the
Solicitor.
 
   (c)   Thereupon, the Director shall examine such supporting information and
documents, and being satisfied that the applicant is the owner of any such
vehicle, that the same is a safe and fit conveyance, and that satisfactory
liability insurance or bond has been issued a license to the applicant, to be
signed by the Director.
 
   (d)   A certified copy of such license shall exhibited in a prominent place
in such taxicab at all times.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73; Ord. 75-84. Passed 12-30-75.)
 
773.05 APPLICATION, EXAMINATION AND FEES FOR TAXICAB DRIVER LICENSE.
   (a)   No person shall drive a taxicab in this City unless duly licensed as
herein provided.
 
   (b)   Every driver of a taxicab, before receiving such license, shall make
application to the Service-Safety Director on forms to be supplied by the
Director's office. Such application forms shall require the following
information to be furnished by the applicant under oath:
      (1)   Photograph and fingerprints of the applicant;
      (2)   Citizenship and ability to read, write and speak the English
language;
      (3)   Applicant's name, aliases, place and date of birth, social security
number and addresses for the previous five years;
      (4)   Applicant's current Ohio auto operator's license number;
      (5)   Sufficient medical history of applicant to determine his ability to
see and his freedom from other physical or mental disabilities (including the
use of alcohol and drugs) which might impair his ability to drive;
      (6)   Applicant's previous criminal record, if any; and
      (7)   Such other information as the Service-Safety Director may require.
 
   (c)   In addition, the applicant shall be examined by the Service-Safety
Director as to such applicant's knowledge of the provisions governing the
operation of taxicabs and his knowledge of the City and its traffic
regulations.
 
   (d)   Each application shall be accompanied by a fee of five dollars
($5.00).
 
   (e)   Upon receipt of the above, if the Service-Safety Director is satisfied
that the applicant is a citizen; is at least twenty-one years of age; has a
valid Ohio operator's license; is not suffering from any physical or mental
disability which would impair his safe driving ability; has sufficient
knowledge of the City traffic regulation; has not been convicted of homicide,
kidnapping, assault, a theft offense, burglary, robbery, arson, a sex offense
or an offense of violence, as defined by the Ohio Revised Code or these
Codified Ordinances, within five years immediately preceding his application;
and has complied with all other requirements herein set forth, the Service-
Safety Director shall issue a license which shall be valid until December 31 of
the year in which it is issued.
(Ord. 75-84. Passed 12-30-75.)
 
773.06 SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   (a)   Whenever the holder of an operator's license violates a provision of
this chapter or any rule, regulation or lawful order of the Service-Safety
Director, or, for a period of sixty days, fails to make a reasonable or
consistent effort to operate any taxicab, the Director shall have the power to
either suspend or revoke such license.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
   (b)   Whenever a licensed driver is convicted of driving a taxicab during a
period in which his license has been suspended, the Service-Safety Director
shall revoke the license of such driver and such driver shall not be eligible
to receive a renewal for a period of one year from the date of such revocation.
 
   (c)   The Service-Safety Director may permanently revoke or temporarily
suspend the license of any licensed driver for any of the following reasons:
      (1)   The licensee has obtained a license by false statement or
misrepresentation.
      (2)   The licensee has become physically or mentally incapable of driving
a taxicab.
      (3)   The licensee has been convicted of any of the offenses set forth in
Section
773.05(e).
      (4)   The licensee has contracted one of the diseases set forth in Ohio
R.C. 3701.24.
         (Ord. 75-84. Passed 12-30-75.)
 
773.07 RENEWAL OF LICENSE.
   All taxicab operators licensed under the provisions of this chapter, at the
completion of the year for which such license was issued, shall be entitled to
a renewal for each succeeding year without a finding of convenience and
necessity, provided all other requirements of this chapter have been complied
with.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
773.08 RATES.
   (a)   All taxicab operators shall file with the City a current rate
schedule, and a printed list of the rates to be charged passengers for
transportation shall be visibly displayed in all taxicabs.
 
   (b)   No operator or driver of a taxicab shall charge an amount in excess of
such printed rates unless the same is done pursuant to an agreement between the
passenger and the driver entered into prior to leaving the place of departure.
 
   (c)   No person, with intent to defraud, shall refuse or fail to pay, or
abscond without paying, the lawful charge for any taxicab service.
(Ord. 75-84. Passed 12-30-75.)
 
773.09 TAXICAB EQUIPMENT REQUIREMENTS.
   Every taxicab shall be kept in a safe and sanitary operating condition and
shall at all times maintain the following equipment in good working order:
   (a)   A light and heater within the passenger compartment;
   (b)   A spare tire capable of being used on any of the wheels of the vehicle
and a set of tools for changing tires;
   (c)   Two independently acting and entirely disconnected braking systems,
either of which is capable of stopping the vehicle without load at a distance
of thirty-seven feet when operating on a level, dry, asphalt street at a speed
of twenty miles per hour;
   (d)   Safety or shatterproof glass in all windshields, windows and doors;
   (e)   Seatbelts sufficient in number to accommodate all passengers.
      (Ord. 75-84. Passed 12-30-75.)
 
773.10 LIMITATIONS ON USE.
   No driver or operator of a taxicab shall:
   (a)   Carry more passengers than the vehicle was designed to carry;
   (b)   Knowingly operate any taxicab in which there has been carried any
passenger having a disease set forth in Ohio R.C. 3701.24 until the taxicab has
been thoroughly cleaned and disinfected to the satisfaction of health
officials; or
   (c)   Fail or refuse to report and deliver to the police all property of
value left in any taxicab by passengers.
      (Ord. 75-84. Passed 12-30-75.)
 
773.11 RECORDS.
   (a)   The operator of taxicabs shall keep a record of all such vehicles
showing the body number, the City license number, the State registration and
such other data as may be necessary to identify the drivers of such taxicabs at
all times, including the hours of employment of each driver.
 
   (b)   All taxicab operators shall see that records are made showing the time
of beginning and the time of ending of each trip, the first and last stop and
the amount of fares collected.
 
   (c)   Such record shall be subject to inspection at all times by law
enforcement officers and shall not be destroyed for a period of one year.
(Ord. 75-84. Passed 12-30-75.)
 
773.12 LIMITATION ON NUMBER OF TAXICABS.
   Unless it is otherwise determined by Council to be a matter of public
convenience and necessity, no taxicab operator shall have more than seven
licensed taxicabs.
(Ord. 79-9. Passed 2-27-79.)
 
773.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 775
Pool Halls
775.01   Defined.
775.02   License required.
775.03   Minors prohibited.
775.04   Posting signs.
775.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.51, 715.61
Gambling - see GEN. OFF.
517.02 et seq.
 
775.01 DEFINED.
   "Pool hall" means any room, house, building, structure or place used or kept
for the purpose of playing the game of billiards, pool or any coin operated
game.
(Ord. 80-22. Passed 5-27-80.)
 
775.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person, firm or corporation shall engage in the business of operating a
pool hall without first obtaining a license therefor the Service-Safety
Director as provided for by Chapter
701 . The annual fee for such license shall be ten dollars ($10.00). Such
license shall be valid for one year from the date of issuance.
(Ord. 80-22. Passed 5-27-80.)
 
775.03 MINORS PROHIBITED.
   No person, firm or corporation operating a pool hall shall permit or allow
any minor under the age of eighteen years to play or use any of the equipment
therein or to be on the premises thereof.
(Ord. 80-22. Passed 5-27-80.)
 
775.04 POSTING SIGNS.
   The proprietor, manager or keeper of any pool hall to post conspicuously in
his place of business the following sign:
   "Minors Under The Age of Eighteen (18) Years Not Allowed In This
Establishment"
(Ord. 80-22. Passed 5-27-80.)
 
775.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates Sections
775.03 or
775.04 shall be fined one hundred dollars ($100.00) for the first offense and
five hundred dollars ($500.00) for each subsequent offense.
(Ord. 80-22. Passed 5-27-80.)
 
CHAPTER 777
Commercial Towing or Transport Trucks
777.01   Permit required.
777.02   Permit application.
777.03   Duration and fee.
777.04   Revocation.
777.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Commercial and heavy vehicles - see TRAF. Ch.
339
777.01  PERMIT REQUIRED.
   A permit shall be obtained from the Service-Safety Director or his
designated representative before any individual, corporation, limited liability
company or other legal entity operates a commercial towing or transport truck
for towing or transporting disabled motor vehicles within the City. (Ord. 12-
39. Passed 7-24-12.)
777.02 PERMIT APPLICATION.
   An application for a permit to operate a commercial towing or transport
truck business for the purpose of towing or transporting disabled motor
vehicles signed by the owner of such business or his authorized agent, shall be
filed with the Service-Safety Director or his designated representative on a
form furnished by the City. Such permit shall only be issued to legal entities
registered under the provisions of Chapter
777. The application shall be accompanied by proof of liability insurance for
the applicable legal entity and its employees for claims occasioned by the
public for personal injury and property damage in an amount satisfactory to the
Service-Safety Director. (Ord. 12-39. Passed 7-24-12.)
777.03 DURATION AND FEE.
   The certificate of registration and permit shall be valid for the calendar
year in which it is issued and application shall be made for renewal annually
thereafter. An annual registration fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) shall be
paid with the application and an annual renewal fee of twenty-five dollars
($25.00) shall be paid with the annual renewal application.
(Ord. 12-39. Passed 7-24-12.)
777.04 REVOCATION.
   The certificate of registration may be revoked at any time by the Service-
Safety Director or his designated representative for violation of this chapter
or any other ordinance, or laws for regulations of the City or State.
(Ord. 12-39. Passed 7-24-12.)
777.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any provisions of this chapter,
shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than one
hundred dollars ($100.00) for each offense. A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation or non-compliance occurs or
continues.
(Ord. 12-39. Passed 7-24-12.)
 
 
CHAPTER 779
Video Service Providers
779.01   Fees.
   779.01  FEES.
   (a)   Council hereby establishes a VSP Fee that is calculated by applying a
VSP Fee Percentage of three percent (3%) to the video service provider’s gross
revenues as defined in Section 1332.32(B) of the Video Law. All video service
providers and cable television operators providing video service in the City
shall apply the VSP Fee Percentage against gross revenues as defined in the
Video Law.
   (b)   The VSP Fee shall be paid by each video service provider providing
service to the City on a quarterly basis but not sooner than forty-five (45)
days nor later than sixty (60) days after the end of each calendar quarter.
   (c)   The Mayor is authorized and directed to provide any video service
provider with notice of the VSP Fee Percentage as determined by this Council
above, which notice shall be given by certified mail, upon receipt of notice
from such video service provider that it will begin providing video service in
the City pursuant to a state-issued video service authorization.
(Ord. 11-34. Passed 8-9-11.)

Excavations, Grading and Improvement

Street construction requirements - see S. U. & P. S. Ch.
