Grade of sidewalks, curbs or gutters - see S. U. & P. S.
905.01
901.01 GRADES OF STREETS.
   The grade of any street shall refer to the elevation of the top or upper
surface of either of its curbs at any series of points thereon. The Director of
Service and Safety may establish such grade as provided in this chapter.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
901.02 CONDITIONS PRECEDENT TO IMPROVING STREETS.
   No department or division of the City shall accept, lay out, open, improve,
grade, pave, curb or light any street or other public way or any sidewalk
thereon or adjacent thereto unless such street or way has been accepted or
opened or otherwise has received the legal status of a public street or way
prior to February 25, 1957, or unless such street or public way corresponds in
location and extent to a street or way shown on a recorded plat which has been
legally accepted by the Planning Commission and Council.
 
901.03 EXCAVATIONS; PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person, other than the Director of Service and Safety or the authorized
employees or agents of the Director, shall make any opening in, or to cut into,
break or otherwise disturb any street, alley, sidewalk, curb, gutter or other
public way unless such person has obtained a permit therefor prior to
commencement of the work, as herein provided.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
901.04 PERMIT APPLICATION; DEPOSIT AND FEE.
   Each permit for making an excavation or other disturbance as provided in
Section
901.03 shall be confined to a single project and shall be issued by the
Service-Safety Director. Application shall be made on a form prescribed by such
Director, giving the exact location of the proposed project, the kind of
paving, the area and depth to be excavated and such other necessary information
as may be requested by the Director. The permit shall be issued only after a
cash deposit sufficient to cover the cost of restoration has been posted,
together with the payment of a twenty-five dollar ($25.00) fee. Such deposit
shall be returned upon prompt and satisfactory refilling of such excavation and
restoration of all surfaces so disturbed.
(Ord. 77-23. Passed 5-10-77.)
 
901.05 RESTORATION OF PAVEMENT.
   (a)   The opening and restoration of a pavement or other surface shall be
performed under the direction and to the satisfaction of the Director of
Service and Safety and in accordance with rules, regulations and specifications
approved by the Mayor and Council.
 
   (b)   Upon failure or refusal of the permittee satisfactorily to fill the
excavation, restore the surface and remove all excess materials within the time
specified in the permit or, where not specified therein, within a reasonable
time after commencement of the work, the City may proceed without notice to
make such fill and restoration and the deposit referred to in Section
901.04 shall be deemed forfeited. Thereupon such deposit shall be paid into the
Street Construction, Maintenance and Repair Fund of the City, except such part
demanded and paid to the permittee as the difference between the deposit and
the charges of the City for restoration services performed by it. If the amount
of such services performed by the City should exceed the amount of such
deposit, the Director shall proceed to collect the remainder due from such
permittee.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
901.06 BARRICADES.
   Any person engaged in or employing others in excavating or opening any
street, sidewalk, alley or other public way shall have such excavation or
opening fully barricaded at all times to prevent injury to persons or animals.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
901.07 WARNING LIGHTS.
   Any person engaged in or employing others in excavating or otherwise in any
manner obstructing a portion or all of any street, sidewalk, alley or other
public way, at all times during the night season shall cause at least two
illuminated red or amber lamps to be securely and conspicuously posted on, at
or near each end of such obstruction or excavation, and if the space involved
exceeds fifty feet in extent, then at least one additional lamp for each
additional fifty feet or portion thereof excavated or obstructed shall be
posted.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
901.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 903
Construction of Streets
903.01   Specifications generally.
903.02   Engineer's approval on certain street construction.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Surface treatment - see Ohio R. C. 723.23, 723.31
Street grades - see S. U. & P. S.
901.01
903.01 SPECIFICATIONS GENERALLY.
   (a)   The minimum requirements for the construction of any street or highway
or part thereof within the City, or allotment or addition thereto, or proposed
addition or allotment, improved by the allotter, or upon any public right of
way within the City, shall conform to the following:
      (1)   On those streets where a flexible-type pavement is adequate and
conditions are normal, the following are required:
         A.   A six-inch stone base (Items 303 and 304 of the State of Ohio
Department of Highways Construction and Material Specifications, the January,
1971 edition);
         B.   A two-inch surface course of asphaltic concrete (Item 404 of the
State of Ohio Department of Highways Construction and Material Specifications,
the January, 1971, edition);
         C.   Concrete curbs, or concrete curbs and gutters;
         D.   Catch basins and manholes to City standards.
      (2)   As an alternate to subparagraph (1) hereof the following are
required:
         A.   A six-inch Portland cement concrete pavement, plain, with
integral curbs (Item 452 of the State of Ohio Department of Highways
Construction and Material Specifications, the January, 1971, edition);
         B.   Catch basins and manholes to City standards.
      (3)   On those streets where a rigid-type pavement is needed because of
soft subsoil, muck and similar difficulties, the following are required:
         A.   An eight-inch reinforced Portland cement concrete pavement with
integral curbs (Item 451 of the State of Ohio Department of Highways
Construction and Material Specifications, the January, 1971, edition);
         B.   Catch basins and manholes to City standards.
 
   (b)   All materials and workmanship shall conform to specifications of the
City and the State Department of Highways.
 
   (c)   The type of pavement required, based on conditions as hereinabove set
out and engineering recommendations, shall be designated by Council after
investigation and advice by the City Engineer's office.
(Ord. 3749. Passed 12-11-73.)
 
903.02 ENGINEER'S APPROVAL ON CERTAIN STREET CONSTRUCTION.
   Any new street construction, street improvements, or methods or materials
for any of such work, where the cost of the entire project is in excess of one
thousand dollars ($1,000), shall require the approval of the City Engineer's
office before any contracts are advertised for, or entered into, by the City or
any of its officers, agents or employees.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 905
Sidewalks, Curbs and Gutters
905.01    Establishment of grade; specifications.
905.02   Resolution of Council; notice.
905.03   Permit required; fee.
905.04   Permit application.
905.05   Applicant's qualifications; bond required.
905.06   Supervision of construction.
905.07   Failure of owner to act on notice.
905.08   Rebuilding required.
905.09   Responsibility for sidewalks.
905.10   Rate for construction work performed by the City.
905.11   Procedure for street and alley excavation cuts.
905.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Changing established grade - see Ohio R. C. 727.07
Notice to construct or repair sidewalks - see Ohio R. C. 729.03 et seq.
Street grades - see S. U. & P. S.
901.01
 
905.01 ESTABLISHMENT OF GRADE; SPECIFICATIONS.
   Whenever Council decides to provide for the construction or repair of any
specific sidewalks, curbings or gutters, or parts thereof, other than by
special assessments, it shall require the Director of Service and Safety to
proceed as follows:
   (a)   To establish the line and grade to be adhered to in such construction
work. If the grade of the sidewalk, curbing or gutter is already established,
such repair or new construction shall conform therewith, unless a new or
different grade is desired. The grade in all cases shall refer to the elevation
of the top or upper surface of the existing or contemplated curb.
If no grade has previously been established, or if a change of grade is
contemplated, the Director shall cause such grade to be established or re-
established and monumented with line and grade stakes and shall cause plats to
be prepared and filed in his office indicating such line and grade as
established in outline and profile with the intersecting lot lines, frontages
and the names and addresses of all abutting owners. Unless otherwise provided,
the upper surface of a sidewalk shall be approximately level with the grade at
every point.
In all cases where a new or different grade is established, the Director shall
notify each owner who will be affected thereby, by written notice of such
establishment or change in grade, and of the fact that plats have been prepared
and are on file in his office, subject to the owner's inspection. Such notice
shall be served on all residents of the City in the manner provided by law for
the service of summons in a civil action with a copy thereof to be returned to
the Director endorsed by the officer or person serving it stating the time and
manner of service. Service on nonresidents and persons not found may be made by
publication of the notice once in a newspaper of general circulation in the
Municipality. At any time within ten days following completion of service of
such notice, any such owner shall have the right of appeal of such order of
establishment or change of grade to Council, which shall hear such appeal and
render its decision by majority vote, which shall be final.
   (b)   After the grade for such improvement has been established, the
Director shall prepare and cause to be filed in his office, plans and
specifications for the construction or repair contemplated, setting forth
clearly the scope of the work, with full dimensions, the type, quality and
quantity of materials and workmanship required, methods of construction to be
employed and such other matters as may be appropriate. Cement for such
construction shall consist of at least one part of cement to two parts of clean
sand and four parts of clean gravel or stone.
      (Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
905.02 RESOLUTION OF COUNCIL; NOTICE.
   Council, by resolution, may approve all or any sectional part of the plans
and specifications referred to in Section
905.01(b), and order the construction or repair of the specified sidewalk,
curbing or gutter. A written notice of the passage of such resolution shall be
given to the owner or agent of the owner of each parcel of land abutting upon
such improvement in the manner provided in Ohio R. C. 729.03.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
905.03 PERMIT REQUIRED; FEE.
   No person, other than the Service-Safety Director or his authorized
employees or agents, shall construct or repair any sidewalk, curbing or gutter
without first obtaining a permit from such Director to do so. The fee for such
permit shall be a minimum of five dollars ($5.00) for fifty square feet or
less. For those projects in excess of fifty square feet, the fee shall be five
dollars ($5.00) for the next estimated 500 square feet and five dollars ($5.00)
additional for those projects larger than 550 square feet.
(Ord. 77-23. Passed 5-10-77.)
 
905.04 PERMIT APPLICATION.
   Each application for a permit shall be made in writing by the person
employed to do the work, specifying the work to be done, and shall be signed by
the applicant and the owner.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
905.05 APPLICANT'S QUALIFICATIONS; BOND REQUIRED.
   Each applicant for a permit shall be experienced and qualified, in the
opinion of the Director of Service and Safety to do the work contemplated in
full accordance with the City's requirements. Applicants shall give bond in an
amount to be determined by the Director, but in no case less than five hundred
dollars ($500.00) for new construction, or one hundred dollars ($100.00) for
repair work with sufficient surety, conditioned that such applicant will fully
indemnify the City and save it harmless from loss or damage occasioned to it,
directly or indirectly, from any act or omission in the performance of any such
work, and that he will replace and restore to their pre-existing conditions any
portion of any street, curbing, sidewalk or other City owned or controlled
property which may be disturbed or interfered with by him in such construction.
In the event the applicant and owner are the same person and the work specified
to be done in the permit is upon the owner's property and no other, then in
such cases the surety requirements shall not apply.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
905.06 SUPERVISION OF CONSTRUCTION.
   Upon granting of a permit for the construction of the improvement, the
permittee shall proceed immediately with the improvement contemplated by the
resolution of Council referred to in Section
905.02 and shall complete the same without unnecessary delay. The Director of
Service and Safety shall supervise the construction or repair and shall see
that the work has been faithfully performed according to plans and
specifications before final approval.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
905.07 FAILURE OF OWNER TO ACT ON NOTICE.
   After fifteen days from the date of completion of notice to the owner of the
resolution referred to in Section
905.02, if no application for a permit is pending and no permit has been
granted to or on behalf of any owner, the Director of Service and Safety or
Council, shall proceed to construct or repair the sidewalks at the expense of
such owner or employ a contract to perform such work at the owner's expense.
All expenses so incurred shall be assessed on such abutting property. Such
assessment shall be collected in the same manner, with a penalty of five
percent and interest for failure to pay at the time fixed by the assessing
ordinance, as in the case of improvements.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
905.08 REBUILDING REQUIRED.
   No person shall construct or repair any sidewalk, curb or gutter without a
permit duly issued, or not in conformity with the grade as established, or with
workmanship or materials not in conformity with the required specifications.
Council shall order any such unlawfully constructed sidewalk, curbing or gutter
to be destroyed and rebuilt by the owner of the abutting property in conformity
with the provisions of this chapter, and upon failure of such owner to comply
with such order within fifteen days Council shall provide for such destruction
and rebuilding and shall assess all costs for the same on such owner as
provided in Section
905.07.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
905.09 RESPONSIBILITY FOR SIDEWALKS.
   (a)   Every owner, occupant, lessee, person or agent having charge, control
or ownership of any tenement, building, lot or land fronting on any avenue,
street, alley, road or other public highway of the City is charged with the
construction, maintenance and repair of the necessary sidewalks, or parts
thereof located upon such lot or land, within the limits of the City, and such
owner, occupant, person or agent shall be liable in money damages to any
person, who, while in the lawful use of such sidewalks, sustains an injury to
person or damage to property, by reason of the failure of such owner, lessee,
occupant, person or agent in charge, to maintain the sidewalk in good repair
and free from any defect.
 
   (b)   If by reason of the failure of such owner, occupant, lessee, person or
agent in charge, as referred to in subsection (a) above, to maintain the
sidewalk in good repair and free of any defect, a claim is made or a money
judgment obtained against the City, by any person sustaining injury for failure
to repair or maintain a sidewalk free of any defect, the owner, occupant,
lessee, person or agent in charge, shall be liable to and reimburse the City
for all money paid by the City on any claim made or judgment obtained against
the City, by any person injured by reason thereof.
(Ord. 94-40. Passed 4-26-94.)
 
905.10 RATE FOR CONSTRUCTION WORK PERFORMED BY THE CITY.
   All sidewalk and curb construction performed by City employees at the
request of City residents shall be performed at the then market rate as
reasonably determined by the Service-Safety Director.
(Ord. 18-87. Passed 1-8-18.)
 
905.11  PROCEDURE FOR STREET AND ALLEY EXCAVATION CUTS.
   (a)   The City does hereby adopt the procedure as set forth in subsection
(b) hereof for obtaining approval for street and alley excavation cuts by
utilities, contractors and individuals, which procedure shall be strictly
followed for all street and alley excavation cuts.
 
   (b)   (1)   Obtain permit from City Engineer's Office.
      (2)   Permit requisition shall include detailed description of location,
site, and number of cuts. Utilities performing a series of excavations shall
submit a detailed program plan and obtain a permit for each street or alley
separately.
      (3)   Permit fees shall be a minimum of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for
each cut and shall be accompanied by a minimum of one hundred dollars ($100.00)
bond. The City Engineer shall establish higher bonds for more extensive work.
Utility companies may submit an annual bond of five thousand dollars ($5,000)
if they choose and they shall be solely responsible for restoring their own
street openings within a thirty day period.
      (4)   All cuts made in pavement within City right-of-way shall first be
outlined by saw cuts. Following repair work or pipe taps, openings shall be
filled with ODOT item 304 machine compacted in 12" lifts. Other options of
filling may be to use controlled density fill or tampcrete. These materials
shall be liquid enough to fill all voids in the excavation. Prior approval must
be obtained from the City Engineer as to method of repair. The City Engineer
may give approval for alternative methods if, in his sole discretion, he
approves the method.
      (5)   After backfilling with compacted granular or optional material,
permit holder shall perform one of the options below, depending upon weather
and seasonal conditions:
         A.   The contractor is to match the existing roadway's thickness of
asphaltic concrete with the minimum following guidelines: Thoroughfares, State,
County roadways place 6" asphalt pavement #404 compacted with minimum 5 Ton
roller or vibrator compactor. Seal all edges at sawcuts with AC-20. Local
streets and alleys place 3" asphalt pavement #404 or tar and chip covering to
match existing pavement.
 
OR
 
         B.   Place temporary 3" cold mix patch if weather prohibits pavement
patch. Maintain until permanent patch is replaced. Granular backfill or other
option material to be placed as noted above.
         C.   Emergency repairs to be backfilled with granular material
compacted as above and maintained. Place temporary or permanent patch within 72
hours of backfilling unless weather prevents asphaltic material from being
placed.
         D.   On concrete streets use 6" concrete 6 bag mix flush with existing
pavement. Tool edges and place sealant in perimeter joint.
      (6)   Notify City Engineering Office when work is to be performed so that
procedures can be verified by Inspector. The City may complete or redo the work
and charge the permit holder for work performed by City employees if proper
procedures are not followed.
 
   (c)   Whoever violates any provision of this section is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor upon the first offense; and a fourth degree misdemeanor upon each
subsequent offense and/or violation thereof.
(Ord. 94-61. Passed 7-12-94.)
 
905.99 PENALTY
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a
minor misdemeanor. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during
or on which a violation occurs or continues.
 
 
 
CHAPTER 906
House Numbering
906.01   Numbering required.
906.02   Preparation of plat.
906.03   House Numbering Map.
906.04   Duty of owners.
906.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate building numbering - see Ohio R. C. 715.26
 
906.01 NUMBERING REQUIRED.
   Houses and buildings in the City shall be numbered and designated as
hereinafter provided in this chapter.
(Ord. 86-104. Passed 12-23-86.)
 
906.02 PREPARATION OF PLAT.
   The City Engineer or some other personnel of the City Engineering Office
under the direction of the City Engineer shall prepare a plat of the City
designating thereon the streets and location of each building and building lot
and designating the number of each house, building or building lot as herein
provided.
(Ord. 86-104. Passed 12-23-86.)
 
906.03 HOUSE NUMBERING MAP.
   The numbering of houses and buildings on all streets of the City shall be as
set forth on the City House and Building Numbering Map on file in the office of
the City Engineer.
(Ord. 86-104. Passed 12-23-86.)
 
906.04 DUTY OF OWNERS.
   Each resident owner of a building and/or house in the City and/or of the
occupant of each building and/or house therein owned by non-residents shall
procure the proper numbers for such building and/or house and affix the same in
a conspicuous place to the front of such building and/or house, with such house
numbers to be clearly legible and/or able to be read from the street in front
of such building and/or house and such numbers shall be not less than three
inches in height. It shall be the duty of any person hereafter erecting any
building or house in this City, within ten days after the issuance of a
building permit therefore, to procure the proper numbers and affix the same to
such new building and/or house.
(Ord. 87-6. Passed 6-27-87.)
 
906.99 PENALTY.
   Any violation of the provision of this chapter shall be deemed to be a minor
misdemeanor and any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter
shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each offense. A
separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on which any
person violates any of the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 86-104. Passed 12-23-86.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 907
Trees
907.01   Definitions.
907.02   Establishment of Shade Tree Commission.
907.03   Direction, regulation and control of trees.
907.04   Permits required.
907.05   Pruning and removal of obstructions required. (Repealed)
907.06   Abuse or mutilation of trees.
907.07   Shade Tree Memorial Fund.
907.08   Protection; planting required on new streets.
907.09   Removal of hazardous trees required. (Repealed)
907.10   Tree lawn care and maintenance.
907.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate shade trees and shrubbery - see Ohio R.C. 715.20
Assessments for tree planting or maintenance - see Ohio R. C. 727.011.
Tree roots obstructing sewers - see S. U. & P. S.
921.04
Destruction of shrubs, trees or crops - see GEN. OFF.
541.06
 
907.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Person" means any individual, firm, partnership, association,
corporation or organization of any kind.
   (b)   "Street" or "highway" means the entire width of every public way or
right of way when any part thereof is open to the use of the public, as a
matter of right, for purposes of vehicular and pedestrian traffic.
   (c)   "Park" includes all public parks having individual names.
   (d)   "Public places" includes all grounds owned by the City.
   (e)   "Property line" means the outer edge of a street or highway.
   (f)   "Treelawn" is that part of a street or highway not covered by a
sidewalk or other paving, lying between the property line and that portion of
the street or highway usually used for vehicular travel.
   (g)   "Public trees" includes all shade and ornamental trees now or
hereafter growing on any street or any public areas where otherwise indicated.
   (h)   "Principal thoroughfare" means any street upon which trucks are not
prohibited.
   (i)   "Property owner" means the person owning such property as shown by the
records of the Recorder's Office of Logan County, Ohio.
      (Ord. 75-56. Passed 8-12-75.)
 
907.02 ESTABLISHMENT OF SHADE TREE COMMISSION.
   (a)   There is hereby established a Shade Tree Commission for the City which
shall consist of the following members: the Director of Service-Safety, a
representative of the City Engineer’s Office, one member of Council, and up to
twelve individuals, who are citizens and residents of Logan County, Ohio, who
shall be appointed by the Mayor with the approval of Council. At least one-half
of the class of up to twelve individuals as hereinbefore referred to, shall
also be residents of the City of Bellefontaine. The terms of such citizens and
residents of the City and County who are appointed by the Mayor shall be for
three years. In the event that a vacancy occurs during the term of any such
member, his or her successor shall be appointed for the unexpired portion of
his or her term.
(Ord. 99-76. Passed 7-27-99.)
   (b)   The duties of the Shade Tree Commission shall be to:
      (1)   Make a study and determine the needs of the City in connection with
its tree planting program;
      (2)   Recommend to the proper authority the types and kinds of trees to
be planted upon designated streets, parts of streets or parks of the City;
      (3)   Assist City officials and citizens in the dissemination of news and
information regarding the selection, planting and maintenance of trees within
the City on private and public properties and make recommendations from time to
time to Council as to desirable legislation concerning the tree program and
related activities of the City; and
      (4)   Provide regular and special meetings at which the subject of trees
as it relates to the City may be discussed by its members, City officials and
all others interested in the tree program.
 
   (c)   Within a reasonable time after the appointment of the Commission and
the approval of its members, upon call of the Mayor such Commission shall meet
and organize by the election of a Chairman and Secretary and the adoption of
rules and procedures including the holding of regular and special meetings as
deemed advisable and necessary to perform the duties of the Commission.
(Ord. 75-56. Passed 8-12-75.)
 
907.03 DIRECTION, REGULATION AND CONTROL OF TREES.
   (a)   The Director of Service and Safety shall direct, regulate and control
the planting, maintenance, removal, fertilization, pruning and bracing of trees
on the streets and other public places in the City. He shall cause the
provisions of this chapter to be enforced. In his absence, these duties shall
be the responsibility of a qualified alternate designated by the City.
 
   (b)   The Director of Service and Safety shall have the authority to affix
reasonable conditions to the granting of permits in accordance with the
provisions of this chapter and to insure safety and preserve the aesthetics of
public places.
 
   (c)   The Director of Service and Safety shall have the authority to
formulate a Master Street Tree Plan after a public hearing and after receiving
the advice and approval of the Shade Tree Commission. The Master Street Tree
Plan shall specify the species of trees to be planted on the streets and public
places in the City. From and after the adoption and approval of such Plan by
the Commission, or any amendment thereof, all planting shall conform thereto.
Such Plan shall take into consideration all existing and future utility and
environmental factors in determining the species of trees for the various
locations, and such Plan may be amended by the Director of Service and Safety,
with the approval of the Commission, as circumstances require.
(Ord. 75-56. Passed 8-12-75.)
 
907.04 PERMITS REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person shall plant, spray, fertilize, preserve, prune, cut above
ground or otherwise disturb any tree on any street, treelawn or other public
place without first filing an application and procuring a permit therefor from
the Director of Service and Safety. The person receiving the permit shall abide
by all regulations, conditions and specifications prescribed by the Director.
 
   (b)   The application for the permit shall be in the form prescribed by the
Director and shall contain information as to the location, time, grade,
species, cultivar and method of planting; the number of trees to be sprayed,
fertilized, pruned or otherwise preserved; the kind of treatment; the
composition of spray material; and such other information as the Director finds
reasonably necessary to determine whether a permit shall issue.
 
   (c)   Applications for permits, accompanied by a fee of five dollars
($5.00), must be filed at the office of the Director of Service and Safety not
less than forty-eight hours in advance of the time the work is to be done. All
such receipts shall be placed in the General Fund of the City.
 
   (d)   The Director shall issue the permit provided for herein if, in his
judgment, the proposed work is desirable and is in conformity with the Master
Street Tree Plan and the proposed method and workmanship are of a satisfactory
nature. The permit shall contain a definite date of expiration and the work
shall be completed in the time allowed by the permit and in accordance with the
provisions of this chapter and as the Director may additionally prescribe. Any
permit shall be void if its terms or the provisions of this chapter are
violated.
 
   (e)   All permit holders shall advise the Director of Service and Safety
within five days of the completion of the work under the permit in order that
the Director might inspect the work for compliance.
 
   (f)   All persons applying for a permit for the removal of a tree shall be
required to replace each such tree by the time prescribed in the permit for the
completion of work in accordance with the specifications provided by the
Director. The cost of the removal and replacement of such trees shall be paid
by the permit holder.
 
   (g)   Whenever any tree is planted or set out in conflict with the
provisions of this chapter, the Director may remove or cause the removal of the
same and the cost thereof shall be assessed in accordance with the provisions
of the Ohio Revised Code.
 
   (h)   When it is necessary to remove trees from a treelawn in connection
with the repair, replacement or construction of a sidewalk or street under a
City program, the City shall replant or replace such trees. If conditions
prevent planting on treelawns, an equivalent number of trees, otherwise in
accordance with the Master Street Tree Plan, may be planted on an adjacent
property.
(Ord. 75-56. Passed 8-12-75.)
 
907.05 PRUNING AND REMOVAL OF OBSTRUCTIONS REQUIRED. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
907.05 was repealed by Ordinance 18-36.)
 
907.06 ABUSE OR MUTILATION OF TREES.
   (a)   Unless specifically authorized by the Director of Service and Safety,
no person shall intentionally damage, cut, carve, transplant or remove any
public tree; or attach any rope, wire, nail, advertising poster or other
contrivance to any public tree; or allow any gaseous, liquid or solid substance
which is harmful to such trees to come in contact with them; or set fire or
permit any fire to burn when such a fire or the heat thereof will injure any
portion of any tree.
 
   (b)   No person shall excavate any ditch, tunnel or trench or lay any drive
within ten feet of a public tree without first obtaining a written permit
therefor from the Director of Service and Safety.
 
   (c)   A person excavating or constructing a building or structure near a
public tree shall construct a substantial fence, frame or box to guard such
tree and shall keep all building materials, dirt or other debris outside such
barrier.
 
   (d)   No person shall deposit, place, store or maintain upon any public
place in the City, any stone, brick, sand, concrete or other material which may
impede the free passage of water, air and fertilizer to the roots of a tree
growing therein except by written permission of the Director of Service and
Safety. (Ord. 75-56. Passed 8-12-75.)
 
   (e)   Flat topping of any public trees is hereby prohibited.
(Ord. 98-49. Passed 6-23-98.)
 
907.07 SHADE TREE MEMORIAL FUND.
   There is hereby established a special fund to be designated as the Shade
Tree Memorial Fund which Fund shall be utilized for the receipt of gifts and
donations for the purpose of purchasing and planting of shade trees under the
provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 75-56. Passed 8-12-75.)
 
907.08 PROTECTION; PLANTING REQUIRED ON NEW STREETS.
   (a)   Along both sides of all newly created streets that are constructed in
accordance with the public street standards set forth in Chapter
1103  of the Codified Ordinances, the developer and/or owner shall either plant
or retain sufficient trees so that between the paved portion of the street and
the line running parallel to and fifty feet from the centerline of the street,
there is for every thirty feet of street frontage at least an average of one
deciduous tree that has or will have when fully mature a trunk at least twelve
inches in diameter.
 
   (b)   Every new development and/or new plat shall retain all existing trees
with a trunk of eighteen inches in diameter or more unless the retention of
such trees would unreasonably burden the development in the opinion of the City
Engineer.
 
   (c)   No excavation or other subsurface disturbance may be undertaken within
the drip line of any tree with a trunk of eighteen inches in diameter or more,
and no impervious surface (including, but not limited to, paving or buildings)
may be located within twelve and one-half feet (measured from the center of the
trunk) of any tree with a trunk of eighteen inches in diameter or more unless
compliance with this subsection would unreasonably burden the development in
the opinion of the City Engineer. For purposes of this subsection, a drip line
is defined as a perimeter formed by the points farthest away from the trunk of
a tree where percipitation falling from the branches of that tree lands on the
ground.
 
   (d)   The retention and/or protection of trees eighteen inches in diameter
or more as provided in subsection (b) and (c) hereof unreasonably burdens a
development if, to accomplish such retention or protection, the desired
location of improvements on a lot or the proposed activities on a lot would
have to be substantially altered and such alteration would work an unreasonable
hardship upon the developer, in the opinion of the City Engineer.
 
   (e)   Whenever the developer or owner appeals to the City Engineer that this
section places an unreasonable burden on the development, the City Engineer may
allow replacement with like trees in areas unaffected by the improvements, as
an alternative to keeping the existing trees in question.
(Ord. 94-16. Passed 2-22-94.)
 
907.09 REMOVAL OF HAZARDOUS TREES REQUIRED. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
907.09 was repealed by Ordinance 18-36.)
 
907.10  TREE LAWN CARE AND MAINTENANCE.
   The owner or occupant of the premises fronting the tree lawn or boulevard,
which is defined as that area between a sidewalk and street, shall be the
custodian of the tree lawn or boulevard and shall be responsible for the
necessary mowing and maintenance to keep the same in good condition, mowed and
free of trash or debris. No trees, flowers or shrubbery shall be planted
thereon or removed therefrom except by written permission of the Service-Safety
Director. No structure or object of any type shall be placed in such tree lawn
or boulevard except by written permission of the Service-Safety Director.
(Ord. 15-46. Passed 9-9-15.)
 
907.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree. A separate offense
shall be deemed committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or
continues.
(Ord. 75-56. Passed 8-12-75.)

907.01
 
921.01 ERECTION OF POLES; PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person shall erect a pole or post, or a series of poles or posts, on any
public way in the City, for the purpose of operating a utility, without first
obtaining a permit therefor from the office of the Mayor.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
921.02 EXTENSION OF UTILITIES BEYOND CITY LIMITS.
   No utility main, tap or other service shall be extended to consumers located
outside the corporate limits of the City without the prior approval of Council.
(Ord. 75-31. Passed 5-13-75.)
 
921.03 UTILITIES IN ANNEXED TERRITORIES.
   Where there is a proposed annexation of territory to the City, Council may,
by ordinance, authorize the extension of utilities to such territory. Such
ordinance shall contain a provision for a written contract between the City and
the party or parties requesting annexation, which shall set forth the date when
such annexation, including the filing of necessary plats with the County
Recorder, is to be completed and the action to be taken in the event that such
annexation is not completed by such specified date. Such contract shall also
provide for the course of action to be taken in the event that the annexation
is not completed at all.
(Ord. 75-16. Passed 3-11-75.)
 
921.04  UTILITY SERVICE, BILLING AND DEPOSIT PROCEDURES.
   (a)    User Classes: The division of users within the Municipality's service
area is to be determined by the function of such users. Stated in five general
classes, they are:
      (1)   Residential user. Any user of the public water system, or
contributor to the public sanitation and sewer system who is a single-family
residential unit. The sole purpose of the property is for housing of a single-
family residence. Such residence must be metered and billed as a single unit by
the City Utility Department. Duplex, triplex and apartment units may be
classified as a residential user only if each residential unit is metered and
billed separately. Residential users shall also include any property not
otherwise mentioned herein.
      (2)   Commercial user. Any user of the public water system or contributor
to the public sanitation and sewer system whose primary function is retail,
wholesale, service or other commercial activity. The purpose of said property
is for the conduct of business.
      (3)   Industrial user. Any user of the public water system, or
contributor to the public sanitation and sewer system whose primary function is
the manufacture, fabrication, or assembly of goods classified as manufacturing
by the City Zoning Code.
      (4)   Institution or other public user. Any user of the public water
system, or contributor to the public sanitation and sewer system, whose primary
function is public service. Such users may include, but are not limited to:
hospitals, prisons, government offices, charitable institutions, and public
service operations. Combined users shall be classified as Commercial Users for
the purpose of computing user charges.
      (5)   Non-resident. Any user of the public water system, or contributor
to the public sanitation and sewer system where the utility service provided is
located outside the corporate limits of the City. Such user has been previously
authorized by City Council.
 
   (b)   All charges for City utility services for all user classes shall be
billed and paid monthly. The billing, payment and utility turn-off schedule for
City utility services shall be as follows:
 
(1) Initial Billing Amount       Dated the first of month, due on the 15th of
                                 the month
(2) Late Amount Due              Sixteenth day of the month
(3) Delinquent Fee Charged       Once the account is 45 days or more delinquent
(4) Utilities turned off by City Beginning with the second day of the month on
                                 accounts 45 days or more past due.
   (c)   All subscribers to City utility services shall, before City utility
services are rendered, be required to make a deposit with the City Utility
Department to be held as security for payment in full of such subscriber's bill
with the City Utility Department; except that persons who own and reside in the
residence for which application for utility service is being made, need not
make such utility deposit. All residential subscribers will be required to make
a one hundred fifty dollar ($150.00) deposit. All commercial and institution or
public users will be required to make a two hundred dollar ($200.00) deposit.
All industrial subscribers will be required to make a two hundred fifty dollar
($250.00) deposit. In the discretion of the Service-Safety Director or his duly
authorized representative, a deposit of more than the stated user class may be
required of certain proposed high volume subscribers and the Service-Safety
Director or his duly authorized representative in the Utility Department shall
set such required deposit based on the proposed use and volume of City
utilities required.
      (1)   Further, any individual or potential subscriber who secures a City
resident who is an owner of real property in the City and who has no delinquent
City utility accounts as a co-signer for such utility services need not make
such utility deposit. A subscriber is not eligible to be a co-signer for him or
herself when the subscriber is renting a property as their primary residence.
      (2)   All deposits with the City Utility Department will be applied to
the subscriber's final bill as payment thereon with any remainder to be
returned to the subscriber. (Ord. 16-56. Passed 11-7-16.)
921.05 SENIOR AND DISABLED CITIZEN'S DISCOUNT.
   Effective January 1, 2016, the Senior and Disabled Citizen’s Discount will
no longer be granted. Those account holders who had previously qualified for
and established the discount will continue receiving a ten percent (10%)
discount applicable to the water, sanitary sewer, storm sewer and refuse
service that which was allowed to senior citizens or disabled persons holding a
Golden Buckeye Card and to those individuals who met the same requirements for
said card (being age 60 or older, holding a Medicare Card, SSDI acceptance
documentation or a copy of any document certifying permanent and total
disability issued by any State of Ohio agency). The ten percent (10%) discount
shall only be applicable to and is limited to the water, sanitary sewer, storm
sewer and refuse service for such senior citizens’ or disabled persons’
personal residence wherein the senior citizen or disabled person resides and is
domiciled on a full-time basis.
(Ord. 15-77. Passed 11-24-15.)
921.06  LATE CHARGES AND OTHER FEES.
   (a)   The net amount of a utility bill being due and payment received by the
15th of each month.
 
   (b)   The Mayor and Service-Safety Director or the duly appointed
representative are authorized to waive all or any portion of late charges or
other fees on City utility bills where special circumstances justify the same.
 
   (c)   Other Fees.
            (1)   Late payment fee of ten percent (10%) shall be charged to all
bills paid and received after the due date of the utility bill.
      (2)   A returned check fee will be charged to all subscribers for any
check returned from the bank unpaid. This will also apply to returned automatic
direct bill payments or any additional form of payment. The fee amount will be
established annually by the Service Safety Director with a minimum charge of
thirty-five dollars ($35.00) per item returned.
         (Ord. 16-56. Passed 11-7-16.)
      (3)    A Delinquent Account Fee in the amount of twenty-five dollars
($25.00) shall be charged to accounts that have reached a forty-five (45) day
delinquency status. If the service is disconnected due to delinquency, a re-
connect fee of an additional fifty dollars ($50.00) shall be charged for the
re-connection of service during normal business hours after the payment of the
delinquent bill when service has been discontinued. A charge of one hundred
dollars ($100.00) will be made for such utility turn-ons after normal business
or working hours in an emergency situation.
         (Ord. 19-88. Passed 12-10-19.)
921.07 CONNECTION TO CITY SEWER AND WATER SERVICES REQUIRED.
   (a)   The owner of any newly constructed building situated within the City
of Bellefontaine in which there are toilet facilities and/or facilities for
delivering water and/or sanitary sewer facilities to be used in such building,
shall be required at the owner’s expense to connect such toilet and/or water
facilities and/or sanitary sewer facilities directly to the proper City sewer
and/or water lines in accordance with the provisions of Chapters
923  and
925  of the Codified Ordinances of the City of Bellefontaine, except in such
cases where the connecting of such facilities to City sewer and water lines is
not economically feasible because of the distance from said owner’s property
line to the nearest City sewer line and/or water line, in which case the
Service-Safety Director shall be empowered to waive said mandatory connection
because of financial and/or engineering non-feasibility.
   (b)   Whenever an owner of real property in the City of Bellefontaine finds
it necessary to replace any existing water well and/or septic system presently
in use in the City, then and in such event, the owner shall not replace such
well or septic system but shall connect the toilet and/or water delivery
facilities and/or sanitary sewer facilities on the property to the City sewer
and/or water systems in compliance with Chapters
923  and
925  of the Codified Ordinances of the City of Bellefontaine, except in such
cases where the connecting of such facilities to City sewer and water lines is
not economically feasible because of the distance from said owner’s property
line to the nearest City sewer line and/or water line, in which case the
Service-Safety Director shall be empowered to waive said mandatory connection
because of financial and/or engineering non-feasibility.
(Ord. 01-42. Passed 6-12-01.)
921.08 MINIMUM AMOUNT FOR PAYMENT OR REFUND ON FINAL UTILITY BILL.
   When any final utility bill is figured for any City utility customer by City
Utility Department Personnel, any amount owing to the City of less than ten
dollars ($10.00) or any amount of refund owing to a customer of less than ten
dollars ($10.00) shall be considered a zero balance and no final payment or
final refund shall be owing by either of said parties as the administrative
cost of paying or accepting such amounts is more than said amounts justify.
(Ord. 24-102. Passed 12-10-24.)
921.09  UTILITY METERS TO BE ACCESSIBLE.
   All City Utility meters that register City Utility usage shall be accessible
to the City Utilities' Department Representative for purposes of reading the
usage and/or repairing and/or servicing said meter; and, in the event said
meter is not located on the outside of a building, the owner of said building
or tenant thereof must allow the City Utilities' Department Representative
access to any such meters within forty-eight (48) hours of the City Utility
Department giving notice of the need for access to such meters. In the event
access is not given to the City Utility Department Representative after such
forty-eight (48) hours notice, the utilities may be shut off to said property
until access to the utilities meter is given to the City Utilities Department.
All new residential single-unit properties must have the meter installed
outside.
(Ord. 24-102. Passed 12-10-24.)
921.10  IDENTITY THEFT PREVENTION PROGRAM.
    For purposes of allowing the City Utility Department employees to be
alerted when new or existing accounts are open using false information, to
protect against the establishment of false accounts, to have methods to insure
existing accounts are not opened using false information and to enact measures
to respond to such events, the City of Bellefontaine Identity Theft Prevention
Program for the Bellefontaine Utilities Department, as is more particularly
described on Exhibit "A" attached to Ordinance 09-32 incorporated herein by
reference, is hereby adopted as and for a City policy covering the operations
of the Utilities Department.
(Ord. 09-32. Passed 4-28-09.)
921.11 COLLECTION OF UNPAID ACCOUNT BALANCES.
   (a)   If an applicant or current utility customer for Water and Sanitary
Sewer Service provided by the City of Bellefontaine owes to the City of
Bellefontaine any past due or delinquent bill, all bills must be paid in full
before any utility service will be provided at a new service address. If after
a new service is provided by the City of Bellefontaine, it is found that past
due or delinquent bills do exist, current service may be disconnected, without
liability to the City, until the prior bills are paid in full.
   (b)   Additional collection efforts will be applied to customers and, when
applicable, to their co-signers in order to recover unpaid delinquent balances
on inactive accounts. If after all acceptable and reasonable attempts have been
made to collect these outstanding balances, said accounts will be charged off
in accordance with the current State of Ohio Statute of Limitations. A list of
these accounts will be presented by the Superintendent of Utilities to the
Service-Safety Director annually for review by the City of Bellefontaine City
Council prior to the charge-off.
(Ord. 09-25. Passed 5-12-09.)
921.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a
minor misdemeanor. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during
or on which a violation occurs or continues.

921.04
 
923.01 RATES.
   For the purpose of providing for the cost of the management, maintenance,
operation, repair and capital improvement development of the City of
Bellefontaine Water System, the following rates are hereby established for
services provided, commencing with all billings beginning July 1, 2021:
   (a)   Resident. The charge for water furnished to any residential home,
commercial, or industrial consumer within the City of Bellefontaine shall be,
unless otherwise provided herein, as follows:
 
 
                              CHARGE
OPERATIONS/ADMINISTRATIVE FEE $15.00
GALLONS PER MONTH             BEGINNING JULY 1, 2021 through DECEMBER 31, 2021
0-2,000                       2.00 PER 1,000 GALLONS
OVER 2,001 GALLONS            3.00 PER 1,000 GALLONS
                              BEGINNING JANUARY 1, 2022
CONSUMPTION CHARGE            3.00 PER 1,000 GALLONS
   All charges for water for residential, commercial and industrial purposes
shall be billed and paid monthly. All bills not paid during the month when due
and payable shall be subject to a ten percent (10%) penalty.
   (b)   Nonresident. When Council authorizes the City to provide water to
users outside the corporate limits of the City, the City shall furnish water to
all such authorized properties at the rate set forth in subsection (a) hereof
plus fifty percent (50%).
      (c)    To ensure adequate funding for future operations, an annual
evaluation of water rates is to be made by May 1st of each calendar year by
members of the Utilities Committee of the City Council, the Administration, the
Utilities Superintendent, and the City Auditor. This provision is subject to
review of current and projected revenue needs and to allow for funding of
infrastructure maintenance, development, and capital improvement.
      (Ord. 21-30. Passed 6-8-21.)
   (d)    Meter Installation Fee. Requests for a new water service connection
shall be filed with the City Engineer's Office and shall be accompanied by a
service connection fee of three hundred dollars ($300.00). No such request
shall be considered without the connection fee paid. The charges for any and
all installations of water connections and meters shall be computed on a time
and materials basis for the meter, electronic reading device, labor and
supplies needed to properly complete such installation with such time and
material costs to be in accordance with those kept on file in the office of the
Service-Safety Director. The three hundred dollars ($300.00) service connection
fee shall in all instances be paid when the request for the installation is
filed with any balance due for the cost of such installation to be billed and
paid upon the completion of the installation and before the use of any water by
the customer. All water meters and electronic meter reading devices remain the
property of the City of Bellefontaine and will be replaced when worn out by
normal usage. The cost of replacement for five-eighths to one inch (5/8"-1")
meters due to normal usage shall be at the sole expense of the City and the
cost of the replacement for meters larger than one inch (1") shall be at the
sole expense of the property owner. Water meters and electronic reading devices
vandalized or otherwise damaged by unauthorized tampering or property
negligence will be replaced by the City at the expense of the property owner.
Any owner or their agent that installs the service connections and meter pits
must comply with all applicable laws and regulations and are subject to
inspection before turning the service on. Water service will not be authorized
until the service connection is brought into compliance as approved by the City
Engineer or its designee.
   (e)    Discontinuance of Service and Return-Ons. In the event that users do
not comply with the terms of usage or in the event that delinquencies are
created, the Director of Service and Safety or the Superintendent of Utilities
is hereby authorized to discontinue service. A charge of fifty dollars ($50.00)
will be made for reconnections required during normal working hours. A charge
of one hundred dollars ($100.00) will be made for all other reconnections
necessary after normal working hours.
   (f)    Single Meter for General Residences. Contractors or other owners of
multi-unit developments shall have the option to have installed either
individual water meters for each unit or a single meter covering several units.
The rate for individual unit meters shall be as set forth in subsections (a)
and (b) hereof. The rate for a single meter covering several units shall be
computed by multiplying the base administrative rate times the number of units
and adding the amount for the total consumption calculated with the then
current rates. The provisions of this subsection are subject to the limitations
contained in subsection (b) hereof. For the purposes of this subsection, a
multi-unit development is a development with more than one water closet used by
more than one lessee or renter when the lease or rental agreement is for a
period of time exceeding three months. Each water closet used by a lessee or
renter under such an agreement shall qualify such area as a separate unit for
the purposes of this subsection.
   (g)    Certain Changes to Service Property. Any modifications or remodeling
of an existing property that will change the number of units shall first be
approved by the City Engineer or its designee after confirming zoning
compliance, inspections and payment of any applicable fees, including permits.
Additional meters needed will be at the property owner's expense as well as
plumbing modifications. Converting a multi-unit property to a single unit
property will require an affidavit signed by the owner requesting the change,
followed by a final inspection to confirm the conversion has been completed.
      (Ord. 25-25. Passed 5-27-25.)
 
923.02 WATER MAIN EXTENSION FEES.
   In the case of dedicated streets, the Water Department is authorized to
construct water main extensions where practicable upon application of the
owners of fifty percent (50%) or more of the abutting foot frontage to be
served by the proposed extension, accompanied by payment of five dollars
($5.00) per linear abutting front foot of property owned by the petitioners.
When an extension has been constructed in accordance with this procedure, water
tap connections to such extension shall be permitted only to serve premises for
which the front foot charge has been made at the time of filing the petition,
provided that the owners of other property abutting the extension may be
permitted to make a tap or connection upon payment of a sum equal to five
dollars and fifty cents ($5.50) per linear abutting front foot of the premises
owned by them. No part of the payment made in accordance with this procedure
shall be refunded in any case.
(Ord. 3618. Passed 6-20-72.)
 
923.03 WATER MAIN EXTENSION; INSTALLATION PROCEDURES.
   (a)   Construction. Except as specifically provided by ordinance, all
construction of water main extensions in streets and ways not already supplied
with water shall be in accordance with one of the following procedures:
      (1)   Procedure 1. Payment of the entire cost in advance. Any one or more
property owners may request the Water Department to determine the feasibility
and the estimated cost of the construction of a proposed water main extension
to serve his or their premises. If such a request is approved, and the
estimated cost is determined, such property owner or owners shall deposit with
the Department a sum equal to the estimated cost, and the requested extension
shall thereupon be constructed. Any surplus in the deposit over and above the
construction cost shall be refunded to the owners or their agents. Should the
construction cost exceed the deposit, the owner or owners shall pay the excess
amount, the agreement for which shall be made at the time of the original
deposit. No water tap shall be made or water service rendered until the cost is
paid in full.
      (2)   Procedure 2. Construction by owners. In undedicated streets and in
new subdivisions the Water Department may permit an owner or owners to arrange
for the laying of water main extensions by private contract; the performance of
work, however, shall be done under the supervision and control of the
Department. In the construction of any extension, the plans must have prior
approval by the Department, and only duly inspected and approved materials
shall be permitted. A contractor shall be required to furnish bond, either cash
or surety, as a guarantee against defective workmanship or materials, and he
shall be required to pay for inspection and supervision of the work unless
otherwise exempted by the Department.
      (3)   Procedure 3. Fifty percent petition. In case of existing dedicated
streets, the Water Department shall be authorized to construct water main
extensions where practicable upon application of the owners of fifty percent
(50%) or more of the abutting foot frontage to be served by the proposed
extension, accompanied by payment of two dollars ($2.00) per linear abutting
front foot of property owned by the petitioners. When an extension has been
constructed in accordance with Procedure 3, water tap connections to such
extension shall be permitted only to serve premises for which the front foot
charge has been made at the time of filing the petition, provided that owners
of other property abutting the extension may be permitted to make a tap or
connection upon payment of a sum equal to two dollars and twenty cents ($2.20)
per linear abutting front foot of the premises owned by them. No part of the
payment made in accordance with Procedure 3 shall be refunded in any case.
      (4)   Procedure 4. Constructing without petition. When it has been
determined by the Water Department that it is in the best interest of the water
distribution system, and funds are appropriated for the same by Council,
construction of a water main extension connecting two or more existing mains
shall be accomplished. After the completion of such an extension, any premises
abutting the streets or way in which such extension is laid may be permitted to
have a tap or service connection made to such main upon payment, with the
application for such tap or service connection, of an amount equal to sixty
percent of the cost of a linear foot, of the particular extension, per linear
abutting front foot of the premises to be served. The Department under
Procedure 4 will determine the per-linear-foot cost of the completed extension.
No water service will be rendered in any case to any premises until such
payment of frontage and service connection charges has been made in full.
      (5)   Procedure 5. Assessment in accordance with Ohio Revised Code. The
owners of property to be served by a proposed water main extension may petition
for the construction of such an extension and the assessment of the cost
thereof in accordance with provisions of the Ohio Revised Code.
 
   (b)   Extensions Beyond Corporate Limits. The Water Department may extend
water mains beyond the corporate limits of the City only with the authority of
Council, and in all cases such an extension shall be made in accordance with
Procedure 1 or Procedure 2 of this section. In any case such extension shall be
effected only by written agreement, and in all cases the right of recovery of
any or all of the costs of such installation of a main extension shall be
waived.
 
   (c)   Ownership and Control. All main extensions, regardless of the
procedure employed, shall become the property of and under the control of the
Water Department, unless sspecifically exempted by ordinance.
 
   (d)   Further Extensions. The Water Department shall have the right and
authority to further extend any extension, under any of the procedures set
forth herein, to serve additional premises beyond any earlier or original
extension of a main without reimbursement to anyone who might have contributed
to an earlier or original extension of a main.
 
   (e)   Estimated Cost. The determination of the estimated cost of any
proposed extension of a main, will include all items of materials and labor,
including any extraordinary costs occasioned by the opening of pavements, or
street surfacing, rock digging and frost, together with allowances thereon for
engineering and general office expense pertaining to the purchase, storage,
delivery and installation of all materials and equipment necessary to construct
an extension, except that the costs so determined will not include charges
occasioned by a water main larger than would be necessary to meet the
customer's estimated normal requirements, but in no case will computations of
costs be based on a main of less than six inches inside diameter.
 
   (f)   New Subdivisions. Main extensions into a new real estate subdivision
shall not be permitted until the plat of such subdivision is approved by the
City Planning Commission and the acceptance of such subdivision assured by
Council.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
923.04 UNLAWFUL DEPOSITS.
   No person shall deposit filth or any deleterious substance or commit any
damage or nuisance of any kind upon the grounds set apart for the use of the
water works or any part of the water works system.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
 
923.05 USE OF FIRE HYDRANT RESTRICTED - BULK WATER.
   No person, other than an authorized employee of the City of Bellefontaine
shall use a fire hydrant on the City water system, or use thereon any wrench or
tool other than a regulation Fire Department spanner, except in case of
emergency, without first having secured from the City of
Bellefontaine a "Bulk Water-Fire Hydrant Opening Permit". Unlawfuldelivery of
water from a fire hydrant is considered theft and subject to prosecution.
   The City of Bellefontaine has available a Bulk Water Station located at S.
Detroit St. for those individuals desiring to purchase bulk water without the
need for opening a fire hydrant. The cost of the bulk water will be set and
approved by the Service Safety Director, Water Superintendent and Fire Chief
posted at the Bulk Water Station site.
   (a)    Construction. A City of Bellefontaine Fire Hydrant may be used for
bulk water for those individuals needing water for construction use or any
other bulk water purpose. A Fire Hydrant Opening Permit needs to be filed for
and completed prior to the water request need. There is a fee schedule listed
on the Permit for the purpose intended of the water use. All fees are payabie
in advance. A City of Bellefontaine water meter will be used with all Bulk
Water deliveries. When there is an extended need for water delivery for
construction use, there is a Meter Rental Deposit Fee (non-refundable) to be
charged with a ninety (90) day maximum rental time without renewal ofthe
permit. Utility service will not be granted to the location address until the
rented meter has been returned. If the rented meter is not returned within the
90-day rental period (unless renewed) or has been damaged, the permit applicant
will be responsible for the repair and or replacement cost of the meter. Water
consumption will be billed based upon the meter readings obtained on the meter
at the Bulk Water rates established.
      (Ord. 25-25. Passed 5-27-25.)
   (b)    Swimming Pools, Hot Tubs, Ponds. Those individuals needing bulk water
in order to fill a swimming pool, hot tub, pond or such water facility will
also be required to obtain a Fire Hydrant Opening Permit prior to the water
delivery. All fees are payable in advance as listed on the permit. A City of
Bellefontaine water meter will be used with the closest fire hydrant in
proximity for the Bulk Water delivery for those properties located within the
City of Bellefontaine Corporation limits. Bulk Water will be billed based on
the water meter readings and at the established Bulk Water rate. Swimming pools
may also be filled at the disretion of the Fire Chief or his appointed designee
and the Service Safety Director for those properties within the jurisdiction of
the Bellefontaine Fire District. The charge for the Bulk Water will be based on
a set rate established for each tanker load needed to haul the water, an hourly
labor rate, and for the total bulk water amount in gallons to be billed at the
bulk water rate established. This will be invoiced to the property owner and
due within thirty days of delivery. There will be an established appointment
set for the filling of swimming pools, hot tubs, ponds and other water
facilities which is subject to cancellation by the City of Bellefontaine
without liability to the City until such a time that the labor force is
available. (Ord. 12-33. Passed 8-28-12.)
 
923.06 REMOVAL OF WATER METER OR METER READING DEVICE.
   No person, other than an authorized employee of the City of Bellefontaine
shall remove a water meter or electronic meter reading device unless authorized
by the Service Safety Director or Water Superintendent. When a water meter or
electronic reading device has been unlawfully removed, no person shall use
water supplied by the service branch to which the meter was attached. Where a
meter or electronic reading device is found to have been unlawfully removed,
the water shall be shut off forthwith and not turned on again until payment has
been made for the estimated amount of water used in addition to any fine that
may be imposed.
(Ord. 12-33. Passed 8-28-12.)
 
923.07 TAMPERING WITH WATER METER OR METER READING DEVICE.
   No person, with intent to defraud, shall construct, alter, tamper with,
bypass, remove any meter locking deive or use any means to change or alter any
water meter and the accompanying meter reading device or use a false meter and
cause the meter for measuring water consumption to register improperly or
falsely.
(Ord. 25-25. Passed 5-27-25.)
 
923.08 CHARGES EXCLUSIVE OF CITY WATER.
   In the event that a lot, parcel of land, building or premises discharging
sanitary sewage, industrial waste, water or other liquid into the City's
sanitary sewerage system, either directly or indirectly, obtains part or all of
the water used from sources other than the Department of Water of the City,
which water is not measured by a water meter approved by the Director of
Service and Safety, then, in each such case, the owner of such lot, parcel of
land, building or premises shall, at his own expense, install and maintain
approved water meters on all supplies other than City water, and the quantities
of water used to determine sewerage charges shall be the sum of the quantities
of water measured by all meters.
(Ord. 77-56. Passed 10-25-77.)
 
923.09 RESERVED.
 
923.10 BACKFLOW PREVENTION.
   (a)   If, in the judgment of the Superintendant of Water or his designated
representative, an approved backflow prevention device is necessary for the
safety of the public water system, the Superintendent of Water or his
designated representative will give notice to the water consumer to install
such an approved device immediately. The water consumer shall, at his own
expense, install such an approved device at a location and in a manner approved
by the Superintendent of Water or his designated representative and shall have
inspections and tests made of such approved devices as required by the
Superintendent of Water or his designated representative.
 
   (b)   No person, firm or corporation shall establish or permit to be
established or maintain or permit to be maintained any connection whereby a
private, auxiliary or emergency water supply other than the regular public
water supply of the City may enter the supply or distributing system of the
Municipality, unless such private, auxiliary or emergency water supply and the
method of connection and use of such supply shall have been approved by the
Superintendent of Water of the City or his designated representative and by the
Ohio Environmental Protection Agency.
 
   (c)   The Superintendent of Water or his designated representative shall
cause surveys and investigations to be made of industrial and other properties
served by the public water supply where actual or potential hazards to the
public water supply may exist. Such surveys and investigations shall be made a
matter of public record and shall be repeated as often as the Superintendent of
Water or his designated representative deems necessary.
 
   (d)   The Superintendent of Water of the City or his designated
representative shall have the right to enter, at any reasonable time and upon
reasonable notice to occupants, any property served by connection to the public
water supply or distributing system of the City for the purpose of inspecting
the piping system or systems thereof. On demand by the Superintendent of Water
or his designated representative, the owner, lessees or occupants of any
property so served shall furnish to the Superintendent of Water or his
designated representative any information which he may request regarding the
piping system or systems or water use on such property. The refusal of such
information, when demanded, shall, within the discretion of the Superintendent
of Water, be deemed evidence of the presence of improper connections as
provided in this chapter.
 
   (e)   The Superintendent of Water of the City or his designated
representative is hereby authorized and directed to discontinue, after
reasonable notice to the occupant thereof, the water service to any property
wherein any connection in violation of the provisions of this section is known
to exist and to take such other precautionary measures as he may deem necessary
to eliminate any danger of contamination of the public water supply
distribution mains. Water service to such property shall not be restored until
such conditions shall have been eliminated or corrected in compliance with the
provisions of this section.
(Ord. 85-8. Passed 2-26-85.)
 
923.11 SPECIAL AREA TAP FEES.
   In addition to any regular fees paid for permits to connect to the City
public water system, a capacity fee shall be charged for new connections as
herein established:
   (a)    5/8"-1" meter, effective June 1, 2025, $2,000.00 (meter cost included
and provide by the City)
   (b)    5/8"- 1" meter, effective January 1, 2026, $2,500 (meter cost
included and provide by the City)
   (c)    1.25" meter-$7,500.00 (Customer must purchase meter through the
City's approved vendor)
   (d)    1.5"meter-$10,000.00 (Customer must purchase meter through the City's
approved vendor)
   (e)    2.0" meter- $20,000.00 (Customer must purchase meter through the
City's approved vendor)
   (f)    Larger than 2"-Determined case by case by the Service Safety Director
(Customer must purchase meter through the City's approved vendor).
      (Ord. 25-25. Passed 5-27-25.)
 
923.99 PENALTY; EQUITABLE REMEDY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
less than twenty-five dollars ($25.00) nor more than five hundred dollars or
imprisoned not more than thirty days, or both. The Law Director is hereby
authorized, upon the request of the Department of Service and Safety to go into
any court, in law or in equity, to enforce any provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 3267. Passed 3-13-68.)
